reviewText: I love these speakers. They gave me Bluetooth in my old car. I ended up buying 3 of them. They have daisychain ability and they have a 3.5 mm jack to use with any self powered computer speakers. I have bluetooth in every room.

Ive had this speaker for about a year and the sound is just as clear as day one. Four stars because the volume dial broke and the sound would still be present even with the dial all the way down. luckily it still pumps out max volume though. I put a peace strong tape on the dial in fear of it breaking further. It might have been my rough handeling of the speaker sometimes so normally this shouldnt happen. battery life could be longer or at least a more accurate battery indicater. otherwise this speaker is amazing. one more thing idk if its just me but when i daisy chain it to another micro the sound dims down and sounds pretty muffled. not as noticble with some songs but just another slight problem.
summary: amazing speaker and decent bass responce.

reviewText: I did not expect this speaker to be as good as it is. It is much better than some similar speakers that sell from 100 to 200 dollars. This speaker fills an entire room with crisp, clear sound, and also has very good bass for being so small. It is also very portable. The Bluetooth is a great addition.
summary: better than i thought it would be

reviewText: Use it while working on my cars. Sound (and bass) surprisingly good for a single speaker and the battery life is very good. May just buy a few more for inside and outside the garage.

I use this as my external speaker for my Surface.  It produces a surprisingly good sound.  I love its compactness (can take it with me anywhere) and its Bluetooth connectivity.  The Surface has only one USB port so that comes in handy.  So buy it for its portability and its sound quality.
Love the sound quality and is so cute! Perfect size, quality, but the blue tooth isn't that great. good good

This little beauty pumps out great sound for its size. I use it in my shop to stream Pandora and Google Music to. The battery lasts about 7 hrs at full volume and it puts out enough sound to fill my 1500 sq ft shop. The highs can break up at max volume unless you apply some EQ to the source, but the sound is crisp and clear. The Bluetooth range is excellent. I place it on a shelf in my shop and stream music from my laptop in my office with two walls between the devices. I let my wife use it and now I have to buy another...
I love this little speaker!  It has a mighty sound for the size! Really happy that it's easy to move around from one room to another room!
I bought this for my husband for Father's Day...great sound, easy to use and it's perfect for traveling, the beach or pool!

The speakers are well built, small, and have good sound considering the price and size.  Don't expect a giant stereo sound, it is made to be portable with enough sound and depth to enjoy on the go,  Volume is way louder than you would expect from a small speaker like this!  The bluetooth paired up just fine with my niece's Android phone and iPod touch.
summary: Got my niece this gift for Christmas and she loves it.

reviewText: I am not new to portable speaker systems. I have many of them over the years from Altec Lancing, Sony, logitech, cambridge sound works, bose, and now JBL I do have to say some of the brands I had bought a while ago and needed replacing. So my wife got me a bose mini for christmas. This review is not a comparison to the bose mini. That speaker system is well known at this point. The JBL though not as loud and full sounding as the bose does do a great job in sound reproduction. The reason I have purchased yet another speaker system is that I wanted something more portable than the sound link mini. Something that I could fit in my pocket but still sound good. I am pleasantly surprised on how well this speaker system works. I would defiantly suggest getting the wireless version as this is the main speaker to my iPad. The built in speaker is not that great in the iPad. I find the volume control on the unit useless as  you prone or tablet will control the audio volume. I think this speaker is great if you want something that will sound really good and fit in your pocket. If you want something that sounds great and completely fill a room then get a bigger speaker system.
I got really impressive sound out of my smartphone from a speaker the size of a puck.The bluetooth set up was easier than expected.
summary: This sounds a good deal better than you would expect.

reviewText: Easy to use. Sounds Great for how small it is. Seems to hold a charge for a long time. Would recommend.

I have an IClarity Monster that is finally starting to sound a little muffled. I have used it for at least two years, and love it. So, when it started to go bad, I decided I would order another one. Then I saw the JBL Micro and read all of the great reviews so I took a chance and ordered it. Well, I received it today and am thoroughly unimpressed with it. It honestly sounds worse than my 2yr old IClarity Monster does and its speakers are now blown.So, I am returning it and ordering another Iclarity Monster to replace mine.FWIW, I also have a HMDX Audio HX-P230BL JAM Jar. It sounds better than this JBL does and half the cost. But, I dislike that the battery only last 1.5hrs.I expected more from JBL given their quality sound systems. I guess I was wrong.

This is one of the most amazing wireless speakers you can get in the market. The sound quality is great for bright tones and basses, and its size and portability makes it a must have for travelling or listening music outdoors.Despite its small size, the volume it can reach without sound distortions is unbelievable.I also find extremely  practical to be able to charge it with the same charger for my Kindle and my Android phoneDidn't give it the 5 stars because I still think it is a bit overpriced, and I didn't entirely like the colors available.
summary: A portable speaker with the greatest sound and the perfect size

reviewText: Small but powerful.Had no problems connecting it to the ipad/iphone. And its loud! Also highly portable and come with a little pouch.
I like it, it is very light, easy to handle, the Bass sound is very nice, connect very easy to bluetooth.

One of my friends had a cube bluetooth speaker which was great and I was debating between that one and the one I ultimately purchased. The product is great, portable, superb battery life. I can't decide whether I like the JBL I bought or the cube more. The reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is because I expected the volume to be louder than the max is on this device. Otherwise it's great and great for the cost.

This speaker is outstanding.It isn't the loudest speaker I've owned, but its more than enough for me.What's remarkable and truly makes this device great is the clarity, and quality of the sound.The bass is superb and there is no distortion when pushed to its limits.Ive tried both the 3.5mm jack and Bluetooth connectivity, both work seamlessly without a problem.Five Stars. Highly recommended.

I bought this product after a lot of thought as i felt that $60 price tag was probably a little high. But i was surprised by the sound from such a small speaker - it can be quite loud! The bluetooth works great plus its really portable - you can probably carry it in your pocket. Love it!
Sounds great!Easy to set up!Battery Last!Worth the money!I would recommend it to everyone!I have no doubt that you will like it too.

Small and easy to handle.  Great sound for such a small speaker.  I have larger speakers that don'tsound as good as the JBL.  Easy to set up Bluetooth.  Very delicate wire.  My son pulled the wire outthe first day just unplugging it from phone.  The speaker does not work wireless on speaker phone.  Itis only wireless for music.  (I was told it would work wireless for speaker phone, but it does not).

In fact I don't know how to describe this wonderful product and fantastic it's small but powerful and smooth voice and clear I really adore this wonderful company started I can say goodbye to the rest of companies thank you jbl
summary: The sound only be described as fantastic I have bought 2

reviewText: This speaker delivers great sound for a low price. This set up was easy and fast. Its definitely worth the money.
No problems at all, was mailed and delivered quick. It works great, using it all the time! Looking on buying the bigger JBL speaker "flip" (I believe that's the name)

I have been looking for a small compact and powerful speaker for quite a while now. I asked a friend if she knew anything, and she showed me her JBL speaker and I instantly fell in love with it. I bought my own and it has crisp sound and great battery life. I highly suggest it for people on the go!
summary: Great Quality for Size and Price

reviewText: Not so bad sound even though it needs bit more of bass. However, considering how shallow this unit is and how light that is, it would be unreasonable to ask for bigger bass.Also, it seems like this is about $20 to $25 more expensive than other comparable units.  I think it is due to JBL name.  Very well made and clever design and decent sound, however, in my opinion, there are better bluetooth units out there with much cheaper pricing and better sound.
summary: compact, clever design and decent sound.

reviewText: Great portable speaker. Light and potent. The battery is fine. Recharges fast and lasts as much as promised. The sound is clear and loud.
Great little speaker. It has a good range. I wish the top clip was a little larger for a caribiner to fit through easier but the battery lasts a long time and is great for the beach/ kayaking etc.

Wow.  I don't travel without this.  I bought it about 9 months ago and love it.  Sounds much bigger than you would believe from such a small speaker.  At higher volumes, I tend to get about 5 hrs. per charge while running on a bluetooth connection.

This speaker is the perfect balance of size, sound and battery life, we use it all the time.  It's great for travel, on the beach, outside, inside etc.  You're not going to get booming sound obviously, it's only a few inches in size, but it's a great compromise.  Also like that it has a line-in wire for those devices that don't have bluetooth.

I've gotta say, cudos to Verizon for their product placement on this one.  We were in the store purchasing a new phone for my husband, when I saw this little guy sitting on the counter.  The sales associate gave me a brief demo, which was all I needed to fall in love.  I have been looking for a speaker dock or wireless speaker to replace my iHome cube speaker dock, since I got a new phone.  While I was sort of looking for something that sounded great and also charged my phone, I have no regrets about purchasing this speaker!  The sound quality is amazing, and it's very small so you can put it just about anywhere.  Battery life seems very good, and I like that it doesn't drain the battery on my phone either.  I just got it, so I haven't used it too much yet, but I can tell I'm going to get a lot of use out of it.  I also like that since it's wireless, as opposed to my previous speaker dock, it will work with any smartphone that I may have down the road.You may look at this and think it's kind of expensive for such a tiny gadget, but I think it's totally worth it.  You definitely get what you pay for with this.
summary: Big sound in a little package!

reviewText: For a speaker functioning on a Bluetooth connection, this little marvel seems much bigger than it looks.  Great pure sound!

I am truly amazed at the sound quality and volume of this little speaker. It's the size of a hockey puck, but puts out sound like a big speaker! It's definitely worth the money and so much more reasonably priced than most of these wireless speakers. If you're debating about whether or not to get it, I say get it!!

I first saw this speaker at Staples and was surprised on how loud it was for such a small speaker. Excellent sound and awesome since you can connect multiple of them together! Great item for the price!
I love this speaker. The sound from the speaker is comparable to much pricier item. I would recommend this to anyone.

I purchased this speaker to replace the kitchen radio that did not have bluetooth. This little speaker packs a punch! Sound is clear, portability of the single speaker is convenient and the option of being able to hook up others to create an even better sound is something that I plan on taking advantage of once the weather warms up a bit for backyard get togethers.

I was very impressed with the sound that comes out of this little speaker. It is a great purchase and I am very happy I bought it. I highly recommend it to those that don't want to spend a lot on a Bluetooth sound system.
summary: Little speaker with a lot of sound

reviewText: So far, so great. I bought this so I could use my iPad to run my kids' show music rehearsals. It is extremely loud. I have yet to need to go past the halfway point on the volume dial, and the sound is excellent. I haven't put the battery to the test, but after two 2-hour rehearsals, it needed very little charging to get back to full strength.

This little speaker produces clear distortion free sound. It's not for those who need to project lots of volume, but for a small area with relatively little background noise, it delivers. I chose it as a gift for my husband for its ability to hang on a nail and for its compact portable size. It comes with a pouch for easy transport.

When I opened it it looked too small, seemed bigger in the pictures, so I wasn't expecting much about the sound. After the pairing (perfectly on nexus 4, ipad and pc), it really surprised me with the sound you can barely believe all that sound comes from something that small.So great sound with a great sound, a really excellent speaker.

Initially I was hesitating to buy a mini bluetooth speaker as I believed it would be a waste of money. However, this speaker changed my mind. As the portable devices we own (phones, tablets, laptops) is ever expanding a high-quality bluetooth speaker that you can carry always with you becomes handy especially for people who usually listen to music/radio or watch movies in their portable devices. This little speaker has a rich sound for its size, the mid and high-range sounds are very nice and the bass is also good for its size. I like to carry it around in my apartment, its reception is excellent and it easily pairs with all my devices. A highly-recommended buy.
The product description says it includes an am/fm radio receiver.  IT DOES NOT!  I wanted the radio feature for use in my boat.
summary: does not include am/fm radio feature

reviewText: This is so nice a little speaker.  Stays charged for a long time and the sound quality is quite good for the price and size.  I took it camping with me and everyone enjoyed it.

This handy little speaker has great sound for its size and the Bluetooth connect is superb. In the two months I've owned it I've used it for maybe 30 hours tops. After two month the volume control wheel/dial broke. There is simply no volume control now which renders the speaker unusable. Too bad, I liked it. One star.
summary: Great speaker with a fatal flaw

reviewText: Just purchased my wirless speaker & I Love it! Great sound nice bass to be this little. I use it @ work as a desk radio, the great thing is I can just hook it up to my phone & play my downloaded & saved music

I like to use this with my Kindle Fire HD. It does a nice job of letting me hear audio books or streaming music from my Kindle Fire and it is very easy to use.  I power the JBL up, turn on Bluetooth on my Kindle Fire and they "see" each other.  Nice! Worth the money for a nice expansion of my sound capabilities with the Kindle Fire.  It is fun to hold or put on a table.  I even used it on my car dashboard to hear my audio book while traveling and it stayed there nicely and definitely increased the amount of volume that I could hear from the Kindle. It could sit under a bed pillow for those who like to listen to audio there. Many uses.
He still loves it, and shows it to everyone. Two friends have bought on our recommendation, they love it too.
summary: Bought it for my husband for Christmas last year

reviewText: I don't have the ability to give it 4.5 stars, but that would be my real rating, only because the speakers don't handle base too well. To test out the base, we played "Imagine Dragons - Radioactive" and the speakers sort of ignored the deep base notes that occur in the intro. They are super clear for the highs and mids and the sound carries very well. We had the speaker in the kitchen and were standing in the office (two rooms away) and it sounded like we were still standing near the speakers. The speaker is small and easy to tuck into a corner of the room or a shelf. And of course it is ultra portable. Blue tooth range before the connection became choppy is about 20-30ft.
summary: Great little speaker for the price!

reviewText: Pretty good.  Only wish the instructions on how to use the product were more detailed...they are a joke!Happy Camper
Great sound quality and a lot better than my last wired set. Perfect for travel and for the new baby's lullabys.

The sound is loud and clear, it connected to my iPhone's bluetooth the moment I set it up, I was amazed.  I still have to figure out how to connect it to my new MacAir to listen to my music, it doesn't recognize it.  I wonder if this speaker is only for iPhones?  Anyway, I'm happy with my purchase, the price was affordable and I love the portability of it.
summary: Good sound for a little speaker

reviewText: I recently bought a wired JBL ultra portable speaker. The sound amazed me.I couldn't image how could a small portable device like such can provide such a crystal clear sound with right amount of Bass and Treble.I bought a Bluetooth one too. I would give it 100% thumbs up.

Love the portability of this speaker as well as the Bluetooth capability. This will be great to travel with and for such a compact speaker the sound is fantastic! Thank you JBL for another quality product!

I love how the daisy chain or audio in cord wraps so cleanly and tucks away like it doesn't exist.The sound is unlike anything I've ever heard from such a small device.From other reviews of the sound and the pictures here I expected the size was bigger.  Thinking that was how they got better audio volume and better bass as I read from other users... nope its smaller than I expected and still sounds like champ.I have NOT tried it outdoors I would assume its much quieter but inside so far this thing is everything I wanted and I'm so glad I read every review from this device and the competitors before I settled on what I have to say is the CHAMP of protables.i've used many before and always thought they could do better with sound power and bass (this one doesn't really PUMP the bass but it is present enough to enjoy and you can't really ask for more) - I can't say buy this enough, buy this.
summary: Just fired up my new JBL today and I can say it really fills the room.

reviewText: Awesome for a smaller room but has great sound, Bass and can either play via blue tooth or plug into the headphone outlet.
It sounded great but must have been defective because it kept shutting off after about 15 min of run time. I returned and purchased something else.
Better than expected.  Good quality and sound carries.  I worked on my car outside and speaker was @ 12-15 away without it being on full blast and I could hear it very clearly.

Purchased this for basically low volume sound on the beach (outdoors) its works great. Battery lasts longer than advertised.. and the sound is far superior than any other portable wire/wireless speaker I've heard.  I showed a few family and friends and they have already ordered it.
It's awesome. Great sound and very portable. I was expecting it to clip on but i use zip ties to tie it to my bike. It sure does have people turning heads.

This review is more for the distributor - Xin Xin. The speaker was scratched, seemed to not want to connect to my iPhone, and the package did not have the pouch or warranty card that it should have had.
summary: Product shipped without warranty card and carrying pouch

reviewText: The sound is outstanding. It's very loud and you will never tell that such small thing has this great sound! JBL is JBL!

I was looking for a wireless alternative to a much larger iphone speaker I bought years ago. This one was reasonably priced and well reviewed, so I picked it. When I received it, it was so much smaller than I expected. It's about the size of the palm of my hand. I thought there was no way that tiny thing would sound good, but it really does! It does as good a job as my older speaker that's the size of two shoe boxes. Very happy with the purchase!
summary: Great speaker, even if it's tiny!

reviewText: These little speakers pack a punch. price is pretty good and the speakers are good looking and fantastic sound. No worries.
I use it with my ipad. i can leave the ipad upstairs and carry this downstairs and listen to podcasts with improved sound.
summary: Great sound for a little thing

reviewText: It's a great little item.  Reasonably priced.  Sounds great.  Excellent battery life.  Compact size.  Good bass response for something so small.
Impressive the sound out of this little speaker.  Connects easily with my iPod and iPad, no issues.  Battery is little more than rated, I've got like six hours of playing at a moderate volume.
summary: It's a JBL, you can't go wrong!

reviewText: I use this JBL speaker when showing YouTube videos to my elderly parents at the dinner table on my iPhone 4. The iPhone's volume is not loud enough for them; using the JBL speaker makes all the difference in the world as they can finally hear what's going on. The JBL speaker's good, loud sound, small size, light weight, ease of use and easy recharging capability make me quite pleased with my purchase.

This has a really nice sound but it loses its ability to pair with previously paired devices from time to time, and you have to futz with it to get them to re-pair. I suppose if I read the manual I might find some clue about this but who has the time. :) It doesn't seem to have the greatest battery life...I would estimate five hours or less. It's still worth it, and it sounds way better than the built-in speakers on my iPad, etc. I'm not an audiophile, so this review is just about the two usage issues mentioned above.

Thank you for all the comparison reviews, I bought the JBL based on those.This little speaker packs a punch!  Everyone is jealous of my little JBL.  I love how I can charge with a universal USB since I already have a bunch of those.  The sound is loud and clear, perfect for my apartment.  My only complaint is that the range isn't very far, maybe 15 ft, so you have to stay a little close but I want to keep it close anyway so I'm happy.
Excellent sound quality, base, volume, design, bluetooth pairing, and price in a very small (1.5" thick; 3.5" diameter) highly portable speaker!
Works great as a stand alone speaker or as a blue connection to a larger system. Great sound and easy to use.

I bought one of these - fantastic!!! So went back to the shop thinking 50 each I will buy one for my kids for Christmas. I am now informed that although they sold extremely well - JBL have pulled them off the market and now sell a sound bar for 100 or so. Well I am going to spend my money elsewhere.  Very sad
it can be comparable to the best budget speakers like energy take classic

Whoa!  Extremely surprised at the power of this tiny thing.  The bass is deeper than I expected.  Louder than I expected.  The mid range is clear and not scratchy as are the trebles.  I'm no audiophile, so take this review with a grain of salt, but all I have to say is WOW!Plus it's simple to use and I do love the dial type volume control instead of a rocker or button type.  The beeps when linking and unlinking are not annoying as some had mentioned.  The LED flashes red when the battery gets low, and solid red when charging.  After the battery is charged, the red LED shuts down.June 18, 2014 Follow-up.  I wish I can give it six stars.  I can't get over how good this 3.5"X 1.5" speaker is.  I guess we get the listed 5 hours of playback.  Sounds about right before the LED flashes red indicating that its time to recharge.  It is without a doubt, one of the best purchases I make on Amazon.
I have owned similar pocket size products from iHome. This particular JBL is more punchy and loud than any other battery powered speaker of its size. It is the best product in the category.

After I ordered this based on online recommendations I saw in the specs that it only worked on Ipad3 and Ipad4.  I am very happy to report that not only does it work fine on my Ipad2 but it works flawlessly and sounds even better.  Well done JBL!Two notes from previous comments regarding sound:  The great thing about this speaker is that it is directional, so you can stand it up and point it in the direction where you want it to be heard instead of trying to fill an area.  Also, placing it near a wall really does help boost the bass.
Bought this speaker for my husband to use when he practices playing the guitar, and he loves it. Really great sound and huge bass, given the tiny speaker size. Highly recommend.

This little speaker packs a punch and the rechargeable battery has excellent life.  It has great sound and the base is very rich.  I'm glad I purchased it and maybe I'll graduate to something a bit bigger in the future.

This thing definitely packs some power if you consider it's size.It's small enough to fit in your palm but it can provide sound for an entire room.Pretty impressed by the clarity and loudness of the speaker despite its small size.Only thing I dislike is that charging port is on the bottom so you can't let the speaker stand while you're charging it.edit:  Reduced to 1 star because I tried daisy chaining this speaker with another JBL micro speaker and the sound quality significantly.  I wonder if they even tested this thing or the whole "daisy chain" feature was just a marketing ploy.
summary: BUYERS BE AWARE - DO NOT DAISY CHAIN THIS SPEAKER

reviewText: Battery last longer than the add  says.i go fishing on my kayak and used to carry my Bose mini and didn't wanna loose something so expensive. This speaker is well worth it easy to operate instant volume control,I wear it on me,you can put it almost anywhere with a clip or string.

My wife got one of these for travel and I got one for me so I can have it when I travel as well, or I'm just someplace where I want to have some music from my iPod or iPhone.  great little device.  Would only suggest that it have a more rugged exterior and metal grate on the front as mine creased the first time something came in contact with it.
This product is such a bang for the buck.  Works awesome and sounds great for a little speaker.  A great buy and I highly recommend this.

You will find other bluetooth speakers with a much heftier price tag that the Micro, but that doesn't mean they sound any better. For the price and the awesome sound that comes out of this little guy it can't be beat.

A must buy. great sound, great battery life, great portability. I was hesitant to buy because of the size and did not expect much. for the size it has great sound. we just got the surface tablets for work/presentations and the speakers are not loud enough. when in a meeting with 5 plus i can toss this speaker into the center of the table ad get great sound.  Plus it can be hardwired as well as blutooth.

I didn't know the first thing about bluetooth speakers until my kids told me I had to have one.  I checked the reviews on Amazon and decided if this one was just half as good as the vast majority wrote, I should give it a try.  The price was right, so there wasn't much to lose.  When it arrived, my wife and I took a look at it and both thought there wasn't a chance we were going to be satisfied with this little speaker.  It connected easily with my HTC Droid DNA  phone and my Nexus 10 tablet, and I was thankful for that.  Turned it on and we were both completely blown away with the rich fullness of the sound.  I've asked several of our friends and family (some young and some old) to take a listen, and not having seen the reviews in advance, they have all been shocked by how good it sounds.  Works well from other rooms and battery life seems good.If you're looking for a very portable wireless speaker with a super sound at a good price, this is the one I would recommend with no hesitation.

With a key ring and a carabiner  this hooks onto anywhere in the house, on a belt loop, bike...anywhere.  I've had mine for 6 months, listen to it for at least an hour every day and it works perfect. Great sound. Easy access volume button.  Battery life is fantastic.  Best mini blue tooth out!

This is a terrific speaker.  Not much bigger than a hockey puck, it puts out a lot of good quality sound and the bluetooth connectivity is straightforward.  No, it's not as good as your high end home stereo speakers, but it is far superior to my previous Philips DS 7880 which cost more than twice as much, did not connect well, and didn't sound as good.  Need a small bluetooth speaker with good quality sound at a great price?  Get this one.  I love it.Disclaimer:  I needed it immediately and bought it at Office Products for about 6 bucks more than Amazon.  There's a price for instant gratification (until the drones arrive).

The sound reproduction from this tiny speaker awesome. Vocals sound amazing.I take this thing with me everywhere. I have two of them and I also use the chorded option and connect both together for awesome sound while watching movies on my Kindle HDX.If you're teetering on the edge of indecision, just buy one. I have my playing music all the time. I walk into stores with it playing and watch confused people trying to figure out where the music is coming from. haha

This won't rattle the license plate on your vehicle, but it will deliver great sound for the size and price.  Light weight, small, easy pairing to bluetooth and has a 1/8 jack for those with no bluetooth.I use this one for class presentations when I am traveling and it doubles as a sound device in the hotel.I have a couple other JBL products and have never been disappointed.If you are expecting to hear lifelike sound reproduction to pound your heart and pierce your ear drums, you should be looking at a professional system.  If you want a device that will give above average quality sound for its size, this is it.PRO:  Great Sound, Small, Rechargeable and comes with USB cable, connects to any usb port.  You can hook up more than one of these together if you like.  Portable, outdoor speaker.CONS:  Just a little pricey, but you get what you pay for.  :)

I also own the JBL Flip (which is amazing in its own right), but I wanted something I could practically carry in my pocket. Without having heard it before purchasing, I was dubious as to the sound quality of such a small device. Here's the deal: If you want room filling, bass-thumping sound, this isn't it. If you want convenience and clarity, you just found it. So, if you keep in mind that it's a portable, personal listening device and it ain't gonna "rock the party," you'll like it a lot. I've heard the Jamz, the Gorilla G-Grip and a few other small mono BT speakers, but this takes the crown and the more narrow design makes it easier to carry around. There are unexpected lows and clear mids/highs for something this size - honestly, I don't know how they do it. Another plus is the built-in 1/8" cable for non-BT players (like my iPod Classic), so you don't have to carry around an additional cord. It's also connects via my Motorola 30-pin BT adapter for the Classic. Connectivity is a breeze. It's extremely versatile and sounds good hanging, sitting up or laying flat. I'm a fan.
Use it in the golf cart and its perfect. High quality sound and louder than I was expecting. Its worth spending the extra $$ on a better speaker. This unit blows the $20-30 speakers away.

Sound is ok for the price.  Durable and easily slips into pocket or hang off a bag.  Sound is not as solid as Jawbone but for price and portability it's good. It will stop playing music if you get a call on phone like the Jawbone but with the jawbone you can hear the conversation over the speaker, use it as a microphone.  Can plug both directly into a device also.  I leave the Jawbone at home and take the JBL when I go out walking or with friends. Colors are nice (I got the red one).
summary: Sound is ok for the price and portability

reviewText: Easy to set up....good bass....very surprised how loud and well it sounds for such a small unit...purchasing another. You can connect them together is a good feature.

This little speaker is easy to pack, and does work as advertised. it was easy to sync to multiple devices. The battery life is good, at least so far. It doesn't have great base, which you would expect from something so small and light, but it works better than the built in speakers on the devices I use most. It is about what I would have expected for the cost- You are not getting Bose sound out of this.
Along with this micro speaker I own a Satachi and a Vers. The  JBL is far and away a better speaker. Clearer, brighter, and actually distinctive bass as opposed to either no bass or muddy bass.
I use this while traveling and it is a huge upgrade over the stock laptop speakers. Although it won't give you earth shattering bass, it provides you with a nice balance of highs, lows and mids.
I ordered the wireless version and received the plug in version.  I returned the speaker and haven't re-ordered to date...

This thing is perfect for a small room or person listening. The bass I'd good enough considering it is a mono speaker it doesn't "slap" bit it gets the job done. Overall pretty good sound quality. Comparing this the the photive cyren the micro gives overall less sound quality. Battery life is pretty sketchy and won't last 5 hours at loud enough volume. More like 3.5
summary: Great little speaker not as good as others however

reviewText: I have the JBL Flip I use at home and had a good experience with.  So I wanted something a lil smaller for my desk at work.  I took a chance on this lil guy and have nothing but a good experience with it.  Say will play up to 5 hrs, I have gotten well over 10 hrs and still was playing before I shut it off to head home.  Sound quality is clear as can be with no complaints.  Easy to pair with my phone.  The only thing I though i would chang is the volume mechanism when I first receive the device.  I find the ease and function of it to be more beneficial.  May not look very techy but believe this was the best when it comes to ease of uses when turning and adjusting volume.  Overall, good exepereince and would recommend to anyone

I was looking for a speaker for my iPad that I could easily travel with and this fits the bill.  It's small enough to put in a purse or even a pocket and has a big sound.  I use it for watching movies and listening to Pandora on the iPad.  We've  started taking it out on the deck for some dinner music; choose some tunes on Pandora, take the JBL Micro out with our tray of food, and we're set.
summary: Big sound from a tiny speaker

reviewText: I would say that for it's size it's a good, but struggles with base.  The battery is pretty good and has lasted without having to recharge everytime.

Sounds great, good range, can point in a direction due to the "flattened" side... Great for the pool etc. I'm pretty cheap but really glad I bought this particular item. Mother in law spent 2x as much and her bluetooth speaker doesn't work or sound nearly as well. DO IT!

Couldn't be happier with what I thought was a bit of a larger speaker but am pleased that it's actually so small and portable.  The sound quality and volume is amazing along with the inexplicable ability to produce some actual bass.  Very easy to pair with other devices and the range for the bluetooth is more than expected.  Can't go wrong for the money!
summary: Small than expected but amazing speaker!

reviewText: Incredible sound with suprising bass for such a small speaker. I purchased this speaker with the hopes of using its aux out to connect my devices to my larger speakers, works flawlessly especially when you consider how much bluetooth dongles typically cost. Highly recommended!
summary: Incredible speaker, doubles as a bluetooth receiver for larger speakers

reviewText: work very well until you drop it on the volume button  remove rubber ring around bottom of the seeker get a small screwdriver unscrew take a part and then solder volume together you will see 4 metal lines in a row in the volume area by a soldering gun for $10 and solder for 3.95 solder the biggest metal line to the right hand side to make contact with  power line on right hand side wiggle it all back together and screw 4 screws back in to the bottom take a hot glue gun squirt then later all the way around install rubber ring back on bottom and it solid as a rock and sounds like a portable Bose surround sound

First of all, I love(d) this speaker. *NOTE PAST TENSE* It delivered some really great sound out of very small package.  I connected this to my Samsung GS4 via wireless bluetooth effortlessly! The wireless bluetooth range was good until about 40 feet away then it became choppy. HOWEVER, after just six weeks the speaker is blown and sounds extremely stat-icky/buzzy/rattly now. It sounds much worse when there is bass in the music.

This speaker is awesome. Very clear, loud and even decent bass for such a small speaker. The bluetooth connected immediatly to my lg optimus. I left my phone in the bedroom and walked across the house (approx45') with 2 walls in between and never lost connection. Greatspeaker for the price and I highly recommend
This is the first wireless speaker I've tried.  It is small and portable so very easy to carry around with you.  It has great sound for the size.  Very easy to connect via bluetooth with my iphone.
I needed something for my outdoor seating area and this works perfectlymy ipad or phone will be safe inside and i can just hang this from a hook and voila!

I have enjoyed the sound and portability of this speaker exactly one time, because it refuses to pair with either device beyond this. I've followed the suggestions in the product review thread, contacted JBL and nothing seems to work. The only way I can use this is to instruct my phone or tablet to "forget device" and attempt to reconnect. This seems like too much trouble to use each and every time, so I am going to return this. Also, many clicks and pops during playback when there is no other activity on the phone (i.e., alarm, incoming call, etc.) Does anybody have any suggestions before I return this useless hockey puck?
summary: Cannot pair this with iPhone 4s or iPad 3rd gen!

reviewText: This is the second one it have bought. I broke my first one. The sound is Xlent! Its a great addition to my golf cart. Everyone I meet on the course is amazed how good it sounds for such a small unit.
summary: Great sound, holds a charge well!

reviewText: I'm no audiophile but, this little speaker is awesome. My wife has the JAM bluetooth speaker and thought of all the reasonably priced bluetooth speakers out there(and there are a lot) this one sounds the best for $50 bucks.She was shocked at the volume level and crisp sound it produced the day we got it streaming from my phone. I was too. At max volume, never gets distorted.Keep in mind, garbage in, garbage out. If you play a poorly recorded or poorly converted song. It's not gonna sound any better than the source file it's playing from. But most songs from Amazon mp3 store and iTunes sound great. Definitely the bluetooth speaker to buy if your looking for one.Now if you want to spend more than $50 bucks check out the JBL Charge, or others that are beyond the $50 price point. This had excellent reviews and I see why. It connects very easy and sounds great.Connecting could not be easier. Press the power button, go to your phone and scan for new devices in the bluetooth section. Then your set. Pops up right away and your jamming. A+++

Just picked up the JBL Micro Wireless. The design is similar to the JBL Micro II with one slight exception, in that its got a slightly bigger and raised grill. This helps the sound to spread a bit more when its lying face up.The sound is great for a pocket speaker. Loud enough to fill a decent sized room with background music. In fact, if you are too close to it, you may want to turn down the volume as it gets pretty loud. Mids and Treble are its strong points. Voices sound natural. Acoustic music is excellent. Bass is present, but don't expect too much from its 1.5 inch driver. Placement close to a wall does make it sound warmer. You need to note that if you are using any form of EQ, then the upper register needs to be toned downed a slight bit or kept flat with songs which have a lot of cymbal splashesThe JBL Micro Wireless performs quite well over Bluetooth. Range is >40ft line of sight. It supports AVRCP and you can control volume, track selection etc. from you source device. Battery life is as advertised and you get about 5 hrs at almost full volume.It has an Aux / Audio out port. This enables it to be daisy chained to other JBL Micro speakers for a louder mono sound. This can also be used as a Bluetooth adapter if you connect it to your home music system.This is a great little speaker. Though it's mono, the sound is excellent for its size. Stereo sound with such small speakers doesn't make sense. I have the Soundmatters FoxL V2 aptX speaker and also previously had the JBL Flip. You basically cannot make out any separation once those speakers are about a foot away from you. So, mono works fine for this type of a speaker..Negatives, though few at this price point and size, would be that the cable should have been detachable, the battery life should have been around 10 hrs, and this is nitpicking.Suggestions for the next generation Micro (III):1. Make the unit slightly bigger to fit a 2" or 2.5" driver, keeping the overall design the same.2. Increase output to about 10W (its possible with slightly bigger drivers).3. Add a slightly bigger battery to give a back up of about 10-12hrs.4. Add DSP to control bass output at all volumes.
This little thing bumps,I really like it and use everyday! Works great on Mtn bike rides ,beach,camping , or just at home...,

We enjoy Pandora at home.  We also take it on the road with I Pad.  This little speaker really delivers the sound when paired with IPAD.  The sound quality is great.  It might distort at high volume but we did not have an issue.  Great sound for normal listening volumes.  Making the Bluetooth connect was a bit mysterious at first.  After a couple of attempts it became automatic.  We are very pleased and would recommend to anyone looking for a small speaker with good sound and an exceptionally low price.  Prices and reviews of bluetooth speakers were very informative.  Customer reviews for many did not support high cost.  JBL had decent reviews and a price tag that was worth the gamble.  We are into second month of ownership with no issues.  Took on a road trip to the mountains...Great sound on the deck with evening wine.

I loved the speaker at first but after two weeks stopped working... I was hearing my novel and suddenly I could not hear anything... I was so sad.. because I really liked it... I returned... I am not sure if I would get a new one or different brand.. maybe I just got a defective...
summary: Great speaker.. but it lasted two weeks...

reviewText: I ordered this a couple months back and loved it! The sound quality was great, amazing enough considering its size. Connecting to Bluetooth with my iPhone wasn't an issue at all, and charging it was no hassle. I used it...I'd say every other day. It never left the house; the most outdoor action it got was a trip from my room to my backyard pool. I was really careful with it and everything. One day roughly a month later, I try to plug in the charging cable when I notice that the small connector inside the speaker had been knocked loose somehow and made it all but impossible to charge the speaker. I'd love to give at a full five stars; I believe three at least is warranted because, from my experience, the sound quality is great, but because of the charging peripheral issue, I can't. Kind of a shame really, but again, just my own experience/opinion.
summary: Solid, quality Bluetooth speaker, but mine broke

reviewText: Good audio quality for single small speaker. People seem always surprised at how loud it gets. Charging can take a little while, but not unreasonable.

Took this speaker right out of the box and started playing immediately!Pros:- Small, compact, light weight- Great sounds- Physical button for volume keeps the level the same between sessions- Pairing was very simple with both iPhone 5 and iPhone 5S- Without charging out of the box, this speaker lasted around 8+ hoursCons:- Does not auto shut off when not playing music- The micro USB cable that came was only about a foot long. I have this sitting on a buffet and the outlet is about 2 feet below so  I had to find a longer cable in order to charge this at the outlet. I guess this is a non-issue if you're just charging this with a laptop or have more accessible outlets.All in all, such a great speaker for the price!
Sound quality is superb, easy to set up and very portable. I used it with my iPad to play music in different parts of the house. Love it!

I was shocked at how loud and clear this speaker is.  The quality exceeds my expectations by far.  Sure, it's not like a great full-size system obviously, but it's very good.  My friends who hear it are always surprised also.The battery life is excellent and it easily charges using a USB cable.

I was looking for a good and small speaker to put podcast that I download on my Android fast and easy. After hearing that most speakers had good volumes I went with this cause of the reviews that praised the superior sound quality of JBL.I have to say I am very pleased with everything. For starters they do sound loud AND very clear. Besides they fell like a quality object and look just amazing. A 10/10 product.
it is a very nice stuff small but powerfull the sound is great nice product for the money i spend on it
nice sound for the size. it would be better if bass and treble could be modified but it is ok

I really love this thing and I use it all the time. Better and louder than smartphone or laptop speakers and loud enough to be surprised that it came from this little package. Its aroudn the size of a hockey puck but maybe a little fatter. The range is quite good, maybe 30 ft but it seems to have trouble going through walls. I use it mostly around the house and I've put a carabiner on it so I can hang it from places.
I love it very much!.. So cheap but very good.Thanks JBL. My christmas was good listening on music with that speaker.
Great sound in a little package. I use this when I teach yoga, super portable.  I would buy this again!
I love the Bluetooth compatibility and the sound is incredible! It has good bass and the volume is unbelievable, especially considering its size. It is worth every penny!

I've been looking for a good travel speaker, and I think I've found it.  I have larger bluetooth speakers for the house that don't sound this good.  It's lightweight and easy to carry.  I love the bluetooth feature, so there's no need to plug it into my phone or computer.  And the rechargeable battery is a huge plus.  I would definitely buy this speaker again.
Is just the right size to meet my needs for music at my work station. Good sound for a small speaker, about the size of a hockey puck.

I bought one with some little doubt considering the size of the speaker. I was ashamed for doubting the JBL when I heard the sound of it. My friend was with me when I tried it and we went out and bought two of them for him. When I was back from USA and at work three more of my friends asked for the amazon link to this product and I believe they're going to buy it. Everyone around me who hears this speaker falls is love with the sound of it. There'll be more sales I believe.
Best sound in small package.  This compact unit has incredible volume. I would recommend this above any units I have tried in the past.

Wow. Amazed at the sound in this little thing. I only got it yesterday so I can't speak to its durability, battery life, etc. etc. but the sound is way beyond my expectations for this little tiny speaker. I bought this to use for work. I need something stronger that laptop speakers for presentations at customer sites. Will work fantastically.Very easy to connect bluetooth.

After looking at reviews for various Bluetooth portable speakers under $60, I decided to go with the JBL Micro, partially because I  had good results from JBL speakers in the past.  After receiving the Micro 3 days ago, I set it up... easy!  It paired right away.  The sound did not disappoint.  Very nice.  The look and feel of the Micro is nice, easy to port and easy to adjust the volume.  It even feels nice in the hand!One day later, it lost it's connection.  The units blue light was on and the distinctive tone sounded saying that it was paired.  However when I looked at my HTC Inspire 4G, the Bluetooth says that it is "paired, but not connected".  Several attempts to re-pair failed.After two days, it won't even turn on.  I press the power button and nothing, no tone, no light, nothing.Sad really.  I'm in the process of trying to get an exchange from JBL to see if it's only this one.
summary: Good Sound, Good Design, Lousy Dependability

reviewText: Excellent sound and very convenient for a bedside speaker. I would have given it five stars if the cord to the MP3 player wasn't so flimsy. I'm concerned it may break if not treated very carefully which is a shame. Otherwise, I love it.
I was looking for a Bluetooth speaker to leave it in my bathroom.... I think this one is great. Light weight and we'll loud oft it's size!

Love this little speaker... If you like me and don't like wearing ear buds all the time you will not be disappointed with this speaker. After buying one for my daily walks I liked it so much I bought two more, one each for my wife and I to leave at work.

I like it, right out of the box it was awesome. I had a HDMX Jam and like it, but like others have posted, it had a noticeable static hiss. The sound is SO much deeper and bigger than the Jam and I like the other features as well. The loop to hang it by, the cord to plug it into a non-bluetooth device or another JBL speaker, and is very light for how big of a sound it produces.
The sound quality is great and you can actually turn up the music without the distortion.  I am actually going to buy a second one to tether to the first.
summary: Best portable speaker I have ever bought

reviewText: The blue tooth connection between the Kindle Fire and the JBL is seamless and works every time.  The light weight is important for traveling...just took it to Europe for 3 weeks and appreciated its lightness.  You have got to appreciate how big the sound is coming out of this small device.  The JBL comes with a protective bag for use when traveling.
summary: A lot of sound out of small form factor

reviewText: I loved this little speaker. I used it with my iPad and on a rare occasion with my lap top.I never played it at top volume and mostly used it to listen to public radio and sometimes Pandora.My complaint is that almost to the day three months after purchasing the speaker has stopped working. I can hold it up to my ear with full volume and hear a little sound coming through. The Bluetooth still connects, and I have tried it hard wired into devices but cannot get a sound out of it.In fairness to Amazon and JBL I have not had the time to discuss warranty or replacement. I will see how that goes and try to write a follow up.
It's very small, portable, and music sounds very clear, loud and cool. For this money you will never find speaker like this one. Thank you JBL, I'm so Happy)
summary: This is the best speaker I ever have.

reviewText: If you want pounding base, go bigger. If you want something that you can link to your computer and play music in a stereoless room ( garage, bubble baths, patio, etc) this will work fine for you. The directions don't give you much, but it's also pretty easy to set up. Just plug it into your computer, or get a usb/wall outlet adaptor and use that. You can use the one for the iPad. When you want to pair it with your computer, hold the on button 3 seconds, go into your computer's bluetooth area, and ask the computer to link to it. When you unplug the USB cord, the speaker will keep playing. Now, they're linked. When you want to use the speaker, tell whatever is sending it the signal to route the sound to it via bluetooth. You will just have to click on JBL.
summary: not particularly loud but very portable and easy to use with decent sound quality

reviewText: The price is good. It is the size of a cheese burger. The sound is extremely impressive. Bass is great for its size. Dont expect an 8" sub woofer type bass but you do get bass reproduction. I have two other types of portable bluetooth speakers and use this one the most. Depending on your music source it can be very loud. I have found different locations at home and at work to bellow better sounds. The daisy-chain plug is less than 12" so if you plug it in to a unit, it must stay close. I plan on buying a second one to see if its even louder. Small enough to put in your pocket.I love the fact it has a rechargeable battery.  I give this lil' booger 5 thumbs up.Oh, and delivery time was impressive.
I bought this as a gift for my mom. She loves it. Easy to use, great sound quality and volume. I would definitely recommend this to a friend or family member.
Great for the boys to have surround music with parties or with friends.It is small, so it is light weight, and the tone is great.It travels with them everywhere.

I read a lot of reviews before purchasing this speaker. Based on the reviews, I was expecting a lot. When I opened the package I was shocked at the small size. About the size of a hockey puck. I really expected it to be crappy.Boy was I surprised. We had an event at work in a large conference room. It did a great job of filling the room with clean, bass-filled sound. Everybody that checked it out was very impressed too. I got a lot of, "Where did you get that?"It paired with my iPhone with no problems at all. Same thing with my laptop. My phone was back at my desk, at least 40 feet away and it never dropped the signal.I am extremely impressed with this device.
summary: Amazing sound quality in a tiny package

reviewText: This is a nice low cost and easy way to get Blue Tooth with sound that is overall good for the price.If you want the best get the JBL Pulse.Beats the JBL Charge slighttyCrushes the JBL FlipThe Mini Jambox sounds about as nice as the Pulse (better than the Charge and Flip and the Micro), but it is too soft.I also listened to some Klipch BT Speakers and liked the Pulse and Jambox better.
summary: If you want the best get the JBL Pulse.

reviewText: This little speaker is fantastic... sound quality is excellent.  Battery life is excellent.  Linked up to my Ipod Touch immediately.

We are not audiophiles but these deliver what I consider great sound for the size and price! My wife uses it on the weekends on the back porch to stream Pandora. It also has long battery life as well.
summary: Sounds great for the price and size, Super Bargain.

reviewText: I bought this speaker to use with my tablet, it is very easy to use and sounds good. The portabiity is excellant.
Easy to set up. Sounds great even with heavy bass and has rubber grippers on the bottom which is helpful.
I loved this little speaker so much I bought another one for my mom, it has big sound, I wish the battery lasted a bit longer though.

Easy to use easy to run, and most of all great sound for something so small.Honestly this maybe the best buy within such price range that I ever bought.  This little speaker sounds like speakers 5 times in size and price.  The Bluetooth pairing works flawlessly, and the charge last a good many hours (thus far I listened to it for 5 hours without issue, I haven't listened to this longer till I lost power).Overall, I couldn't be more pleased.

After all the rave reviews I decided to purchase this. It has very average sound quality (very little bass to speak of) and the volume gets to a fair level. I got it to use in the garage since my tablet just doesn't quite do the job. It will do ok for that but I wish I wouldn't have gotten this. I'm not so concerned about portability as I am about sound quality.
This unit has an outstanding sound for the size of it.Would of liked a little better directions to get it going.
This is the greatest portable speaker...everywhere I go it goes with me!!! Life is great when you listen to music!

I use it to listen to TED talks, radio, and movies on my Nexus 7. It is very portable and easy to connect to my Nexus. The sound quality is much better than my cheap computer speakers and while I'm not an audiophile, I think it does quite well for it's purpose.

It arrived with the charging port dislodged & pushed inside....no way to attach charger. So I returned it.  But it was charged enough upon arrival to pair with my iPod touch & the sound was so great. So, I reordered another one. It's really a great sounding speaker but needs some design changes.I gave it a 4/5 even though I had to return it.
summary: Great sound but design needs some work

reviewText: The reason why I got this is because my laptop's built in speaker was not that loud. Pairing the speaker via Bluetooth is a walk in the park. It is small but can give out a hearty sound. Tried to set it up to full volume which can be found at the speaker itself and noticed minimal distortion which one will not notice unless you are trying to hear for any distortion. The only thing I could not get it to work is that when I use Skype, sound will not transfer to the speaker and still uses the laptop's speaker. Any suggestions? But this is easily fix by using the speaker's built in jack. Still I give this little monster 5 stars.

Honestly, I didn't have high expectations for this little speaker and the main purpose was to play music for my baby, without having to leave our iPhone in his nursery. But the clarity and richness of the sound is surprisingly good: I'd say it is on par with a set of good computer speakers. We're going to definitely find other uses for it; or we might get another one.
Surprisingly great product, light, portable and the battery lasts a long time. Great value. Several of my friends have seen it and have bought it as well.
Arrived with a fully charged battery, easy to pair with my apple devices. Up and running in less than a minute! Great sound from such a little speaker.  I highly recommend this product!
summary: Awesome sound, awesome portability, easy to set up bluetooth

reviewText: After trying around 10 different mini speakers for my cellphone this my favorite.  I also have the flip.  This guy is not far behind the flip in quality and volume.The rundown:Just tried a bunch of these ranging from $20-$60:HMDX jam bluetooth - third place - sounds awesome, it's the loudest of all tested as well. Great bass and does not distort too much at the loudest volumes. nice, solid weight.  However a constant buzzing/fuzzy noise made this a no go. Also resets to 50% volume every time it is powered on and off just like all the others except the JBL.  would be my second favorite if it didn't have the buzz. well priced at 35.Satechi bluetooth audio cube - not loud at all, tinny sound, very little bass, sounds muffled. expected more from the large size of the unit(about 3.5*3.5") compared to others, and the positive reviews. looks cool.  overpriced at 50 for sure.Kinivo wired - not very loud but otherwise great sound. nice bass, clear highs.  distorts a little at max volume. cool looking.  great value at 20Sharkk bluetooth - second place - a best buy at 27 bucks. sounds great, good bass, and not much distortion on max volume. not quite as loud as the jbl or hmdx though.  bland looking.  Comparable volume to most of the others though.JBL micro bluetooth - my favorite - first place. stylish, great volume, clear highs and great bass. Very user friendly and uses a manual volume dial so each time you turn it on it is at the previous volume. most reset to 50% every time you turn them off and back on.  Also can be used as a bluetooth adaptor/dongle where the 3.5mm out can plug into any home theater system.  Nice spot to hang it up on a nail, making the sound project farther and louder. Also has a small flat area on the side opposite the hook so it stands up by itself and it doesn't fall over even at max volume with bass heavy rap playing, meaning you can aim the speaker.  This actually makes the speaker louder than the hmdx for real world usage.  With extremely heavy bass music the mids and highs "fade out" a little bit at max volume since a single driver can only handle a certain amount of range.  Otherwise it does not distort even at max volume.  pricey at 60 but worth it.  great battery life too, more than the advertised 5 hours.  Also, re-connects with bluetooth devices automatically when they come in range, so no need to manually reconnect constantly like with other speakers.  Can daisy chain with other micros also.August bluetooth - decent quality and bass, however distorts at fairly low volumes making it a no go.  Similar to the sharkk in size, weight and sound.Satechi BT wireless portable speaker - worst of all, distorts at the slightest bit of bass or volume. Instant no go and a rip off at 40 bucks. can also be used as a bluetooth dongle like the jbl though. Looks almost identical to the kinivo.  has horrible buttons that perform multiple functions and are super sensitive leading accidental skipping of songs, turning off, etc.  stay away from satechi.Xmini - bluetooth drops easily. by far the lightest and smallest and has good sound for it's size but little bass and not too loud.  If you want portability and lightweight this is the way to go. The alpatronix is small too but heavier.  pricey at 40 for what you get.Alpatronix bluetooth - sounds great, but distorts quickly with any bass heavy music.  Also "walks" across the table with bass heavy songs unlike the others due to it's weight/bass ratio.  Loud, like the jbl and hdmx.  40 bucks is too much unless you don't listen to anything but classical at low volumes.
summary: Awesome - easily the best mini bluetooth speaker available

reviewText: I purchased for a Christmas gift for husband and we love it.  The size is so compact, moving it around is so simple and the sound that comes out of it is fabulous.  I can have it in one room and hear it through the whole apartment.  I highly recommend this product for a blue tooth wireless speaker.

For it's size this is a great speaker. The sound is far better than you would expect from this small of speaker. OK, it's not the speaker I would want for any high fidelity music listening, but for spoken sound or casual listen on the go, this is pretty good.I like that there is a physical volume control on it that says where I put it. I like that the Bluetooth automatically connects up. The battery life seems more than enough for me, but I really have pushed it.Highly recommended.

I NEVER write reviews but I am so disappointed in this product. It seemed to work great for the first 2 month I had it. Now its been 95 days (No returns after 90) and the product wont charge or turn on or something) It no longer works. I don't know if I got a faulty one but its ridiculous. Its never been dropped or gotten wet or anything else that would have damaged it.
summary: Will not turn on after 95 days and no return option anymore.

reviewText: Decent sound. I use it as a Bluetooth for our stereo and also as an extension speaker on my mp3 player. Holds its charge for a goodly amount of time, too.
The JBL micro is well built; the product has a sturdy weight for its size and can take lots of volume including bass. It was exciting to hear the speaker play so clear the first time I heard it.

It works great with my my Droid 3 but does not work with my Window's 7 computer.  Even when they do pair, it still won't use it as a speaker even though the drivers are installed.  It lost a star for that.  it also has a regular headphone jack so it works with my old MP3 player. The sound is just fine for a single speaker of this size.

This is the best of a bunch of speakers I've tested including x-mini, Manhattan, Kinivo, iTour, Rokono, iHome HM61, I am an speaker builder, an audiophile and I do repair speakers, so you can trust this review, this JBL is in another league alone period.Me and Salim one of my very best friends did a comparation between all the speakers we bought and here they are in order of rating:1- JBL Micro Wireless/Micro II by far the best, it's an audiophile sound, top finish, it sounds like an electrostatic Acoustat model 2 which impress me in 1980 and getsloud with the more extended bass of all.2- Kinivo sounds near the JBL in the hights tough not as flat in the mid bass, doens't get loud but for 20 buck is the best3- Old Manhattan with excellent clarity crisp hights to 15khz which is the top of my hearing weak bass but very involving sound and gets little loud.4- Rokono Bass plus mini speaker with crisp hights good bass, is not in second place because it got damage after one day5- iTour-Pop sounds neutral, crisp hights good mid bass but it doen't get loud at all, it distorts before satisfactory level6- Latest Manhattan not as near the sound of the old model ( what a mess ) hights roll of at 9khz weak bass though get little loud7- iHome iHM61 very well terminated but sounds roll of at 7khz weak bass and weak level, worst af all.
summary: An audiophile pocket wireless rechargeable speaker

reviewText: This JBL Wireless speaker is awesome. Well worth the money. I really was surprised how good the sound is. This speaker is just as good as the pill!
summary: This is a very nice speaker!

reviewText: Not sure I didn't get a counterfeit cause this sounds horrible. Plus it was shipped from China with very sketchy emails. IT works but is all treble and sounds horrible compared to the wired version I bought a few months ago from a trusted US company. Packaging was legit but was badly beaten.

I have been really impressed with this little speaker.  For a single speaker the bass is very audible, the volume can be "cranked up" more than my wife can stand, and the portability is fantastic.  Even though this speaker is bluetooth compatible, I always plug in the device to a speaker outlet on my laptop or my iphone.  The speaker cord is somewhat short, but when you see the way the cord wraps around the device for storage, it is easy to understand why the cord was designed to the specific length.  And if that issue really bothered me, I would simply purchase an extension, or I would use the bluetooth feature.  I have never had the internal battery drain to its minimum, but almost anytime I use the speaker with my laptop, I plug in the USB charger.  I guess anyone can find fault with any product.  I have a tendency to look at the product rating, then I read the worst reviews so that I can look for those specific issues.  Now that I own this product, I have totally adapted my use of this speaker to its capabilities, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.  Money well spent.
This speaker is great when you love music .. I can Connect  it with my iPhone and iPad ... Quality is excellent :)

I did not buy this to blast out a party, just to have by the pool while relaxing in the sun.  But almost...it could blast a party.  I connected to my iPhone5 without even looking at the instructions.  I also like it that is has a headphone plug because I have a 2G iPod with no Bluetooth connectivity...I can use it for that also.  For the money, a great buy and shipping was quick!!
summary: BIG SOUND FOR A TINY SPEAKER

reviewText: Great sound for a small speaker! I would recommend it.One suggestion,  add a decorative hook to connect on belt or to hang it.
summary: Good things come in small packages!

reviewText: We bought the JBL Micro and the Oontz for my son.  We put them next to each other and listened. The difference was black and white.  The sound on the JBL is richer even at highr volumes. I recently bought a second one for myself.
summary: great sound in a small package

reviewText: Great sound. Even after researching and deciding that this was the best product per unit price, I was surprised at the simplicity and quality of it.
summary: The Tablet - cheaper than the Pill but goes down so much easier and does the job

reviewText: Like all the other people say, this small speaker packs the bass.  It's so much better listening to either e-books or music with this device than using the laptop/tablet/phone speakers.Definitely recommend.
summary: great bass, much better than laptop/tablet/phone speakers

reviewText: I just got my speaker in the mail and oh my god am I blown away! It is by far THE BEST BLUETOOTH SPEAKER OUT THERE! I have tried three different speakers for my ipad and this is the best one! The volume and sound quality is fantastic!!! It sounds like its coming from a stereo speaker! I HIGHLY RECCOMMEND !!!
The size is perfect for travelling, and the sound fidelity is exceptional. Also it is very easy to connect with my iphone, the bluetooth system has not any problem.

Super portable, great sound! At the beach, in my house when friends are over, or on a bike ride, this speaker works great and fills a lot of space.  It's handy having volume controls on the speaker, so I don't have to mess with my iPod or laptop after pressing "play."  Plus, no batteries needed.  One of the best buys around!
One of the best wireless bluetooth speaker in the market today! Very load for its size! I would purchase this speakers again.
The sound is very good. The size is good for portable. To be perfect it should be able to regulate bass regulation.
It sounds good, lasted a decent amount of time & I really like the built in cord!  I liked mine so much that I bought another one for my daughter~
I was amazed at the sound this little speaker puts out. I highly recommend this speaker. My wife uses it in the kitchen.

This small bluetooth speaker is a powerhouse.  I never thought it would produce the sound it did.  Easy set up.  Turn it on, turn your sound source bluetooth discovery to on and that's it. Easy, quick charging.  Great for a desk.  These will make great gifts.
I've had this for a couple months now and decided it's time for review. This thing is simply amazing. Sound quality is awesome and Bluetooth connect very well with my tablet.

This small device is incredible.  The engineering to deliver the amount of sound in digital quality clarity is amazing.We use it camping, on our patio, and in a small cabin.  Again, we are very pleased with the sound for a very portable device.  The battery does last as described by JBL.

Small and full of sound. I take this thing outside with me when I'm working in the yard, hang it up by the hot tub when I relax, and use it to fill the house with music when were cleaning.I spent time checking reviews on a lot of speakers and felt I made the right decision when I picked this one.**Iphone Users**I noticed that the IPhone has issues pairing with this speaker after you turn the speaker off. Simply select "forget this device" under settings > Bluetooth and it will allow you to pair the speaker again.

Writing from the generation where the 8 track was cutting edge,  JBL was always considered the gold standard.  This little device, (about the size of a hamburger), is distortion free, with really good base range.  A great value for the price. Can plug several together for even better sound.

Very big sound for such a small speaker. I found it to have a richer fuller sound than other speakers in it's size and price range. There are better speakers out there if you are willing to pay a lot more for them.

After trying the Cambridge Soundworks a Oontz and retuning it, this device was a revelation. Surprising bass for such a small unit, with no diminishment of mids or high end either. Frankly don't see how any manufacturer can beat this device for portability, price, simplicity, build quality, or sound quality. Some reviewers mention they would like more volume, but really? This device cranks -- with no distortion.

Bought this for my wife and was amazed at the sound and how long the battery lasts on a charge.  Had to buy myself one too.  Took it to my parents place for Thanksgiving and they ended up buy two of them as well.  Even has a guy at work buy one after he heard mine.  The price + performance for the $ really can't be beat.
summary: Great sound in a small package

reviewText: I did a lot of research on small speakers before purchasing the JBL Micro. Most of the reviews were very positive and after a few weeks with the speaker I have got to agree. The size was small than I expected and fits nicely in the cup holder of my car. The key win is that it really packs a lot of sound for the small size. I put it up against a Jambox and the JBL had more sound. I also have the JBL charge and find this speaker at a much lower price to be great.
summary: Amazing for the price and size

reviewText: The speaker works very well.  A lot of sound for the size and money.Only minor problem is that every once in a while the connection crackles. But I just turn it off and on and it resolves itself.

I'm pretty picky about anything having to do with audio, so I do a TON of research before I pull the trigger.  I like my speakers/headphones to have crisp, clear sound with deep bass.  I also believe that I can have all that without paying the outrageous MSRP for high end products like Bose.  I've listened to a handful of mini bluetooth speakers and for the size/price this little guy cannot be beat!  It powered right up out of the box, paired easily with my phone, and blew me away with its sound performance.  It easily fills a room or an entire floor of the house with crisp, clear sound and actually punches quite a bass punch.  It won't make you feel it in your chest or anything, but it's full and deep enough to easily notice it's there.  JBL did a great job with its design - very noticeable difference when you pick it up compared to when you put it on a flat/hard surface.  For a speaker that fits in the palm of your hand, this is THE best that I've found.  I would highly recommend this mini speaker!
summary: Fantastic!  Believe the hype and just order!

reviewText: This is so small but works soo well!  We've been able to take it everywhere with us and it plays great
Great little speaker for the size.  Good clear sound, seems to hold a charge well, have not had a chance to see how long is lasts but so far very happy.
This thing is the bee's knees. Great sound, excellent portability. The sound it produces is surprising. Don't be afraid to invest in this little guy

I read many reviews before buying this item, and I must say that after a few months of having one I am quite pleased.  I bought this specifically to bring to work with me, as I work in a machine shop, the noise level can make even a full radio hard to hear and wearing headphones is very inconvenient for me, let alone probably a little dangerous.I mounted some nice neodymium magnets to the back of this little thing so I can just stick it to a machine where I'm working and listen to music at my leisure without having to lug around a boom box or run extension cords.  I can hear it from quite a distance if the shop is running normally and have no problem hearing it at my workstation when things get really noisy.Bluetooth range is pretty standard at 30 feet or so and battery life is acceptable at around 4.5-5.5 hours at full volume for most of my music.I definitely would recommend this product for the shear portability, though I'm sure some audiophiles would be displeased with it, as it is a MONO speaker.
summary: Good sound for a little package.

reviewText: This is a great little speaker.  I bought each of my teens one at Christmas and then turned around and ordered this one for myself.  Amazing sound from such a little speaker!
Great Gift for my adult sons!
Was very satified with is product.  Sounds great.  Will recommend this to my friends. Smal  and easy to carry, Like the wey the cord winds around speaker it's self.
Great design size makes it very portable as well as convenient whether in my living room or on a lanyard around my neck in my garden.  Amazing sound quality for such a small size.

Not much more i can say. Works well, its pretty hardy (im tough on my stuff). great for traveling battery lasts a while bluetooth works well, aux cord included on back is perfect for sharing.Wouldn't travel with out it, and would replace if ever lost or broken.

Love this speaker!  It has a much better sound than others in the price range.  It's small size makes it extremely portable yet it has incredible volume. I gave it to my son last year for his birthday and he loved it so much he bragged to his sisters.  They all loved it so much that  all three of them.asked for one.  One got for birthday, the other two for Christmas.

As far as ultra portables go the JBL micro is exactly what I was looking for.Sound-A+ good bass and clear sound.Volume-A- could be a bit louder not complaining though it's loud enough.Battery-A++ lithium ion says it all, I use it at least an hour a day and have not charged in 7 days!Controls-A simple, power and volume no pause or skip.Conectivity-A+ has not failed me yet.Portability-A++ put it in your pocket and go or clip it to you.Previous speaker was the Jam Classic. The only good thing about it was sound otherwise it sucked. Poor overall rating for Jam Classic don't waste your money and make the mistake as I did.
summary: If you wan't portable and quality JBL Micro is it!

reviewText: For me there are three main factors - size, price and sound.Size is nice - smaller than some other ones it is compared to.More importantly, price wasn't bad.Sound - I can't really tell a difference between this and other similar blue tooth speakers I have heard.  They all seem ok - at least the ones that have some bass.  But they aren't very clear.  They are handy and cheap (see above).Comparing this to the flip and the charge in Radio Shack today - each step up is fifty bucks more and only a modest sound improvement.  This one is better on size and price than the other vaunted JBL lineup.The Bose sound link 2 sounds better for 4-5 times the price - but maybe too bass heavy for long term listening.Not a bad product, more bass than one would think.  OK.  About what you can get for this price I think.

I purchased this speaker primarily to take with me while backpacking. It's very light, has great battery life, and pretty good sound quality. If you intend to use this as a solo device then I highly recommend it.
