summary: Little Speaker that packs a powerful sound!!

reviewText: this little speaker is amazing!  i have never heard so quality sound from such a small package! one of the best electronic gadgets i have ever purchased.  i take it everywhere. I WILL be buying another one!

I didnt have speakers in my car so instead of buying new ones I thought I'd invest in a blue tooth speaker so I purchased the $100 Logitech Soundbox and I was loving it but was getting irritated that I couldnt max out the volume because it would loose quality in sound.Then this JBL arrived and when I turned it on, It blew the logitech out of the water. It is very unfortunate that I spent $100 on the Logitech for 1/2 the sound.Hands down this JBL is 1/2 the price , twice the sound at any volume. This small speaker does not fluctuate or loose quality at max volume, so go ahead raise it up.Very impressed and glad that I purchased this speaker. Im sure you would too.

Perfect size for putting in a pocket on my lunchbox.  Great sound with excellent bass.  I use to have a magnavox about the same size that used 3 triple a's and had to be plugged into the phone.  Had almost the same sound quality of this speaker when it had a fresh set of batteries.  An hour later you had to turn down the volume due to bass distortion.  It's nice not having to sacrifice sound quality due to dead batteries with this speaker.
summary: No more distorted bass from dead batteries!

reviewText: I love when an order comes in so quick plus this item has a super sound that I am still in awe it can have for being so small.  I'm glad I purchased this speaker, I didn't have to spend a fortune but yet the sound is about as good as you'd want for a portable speaker.

Nice sound and connects easily. Since it is bluetooth, it does cut out if you walk in front of it and your source is in another room. Check out the ROCKI coming out soon for more reliable wireless transmissions.
Audio pro for 30+ years and heard many speakers and JBL rules! In pro audio to little guys like this they just ROCK!

I used only my iPhone to play Pandora on this speaker and it blew up after only 12 hours of use. The bass now sounds like someone knocking on a door. Unfortunately I had thrown out the packaging - my bad
summary: speaker blew in the first 12 hours of use

reviewText: Great sound for it's size, I really enjoy the quality and ease of use!  I use it with my  tablet and my phone.
Links very easily. Daisychains very simply. \Great sound and dependable. All I was told it would be. A+++Came quickly, great communications.

Great sound from this little speaker. Connects quickly to my macbook, iPad or any other BT device. It's not a Bose, but the either is the price. So pleased with this speaker, I even bought a second one!
Very cool!  sounds great, easy wifi to my tablet, phone, and laptop. Fits in my pocket and its under $50, Im buying a few more for gifts.

Great little speaker. No real complaints thus far.I work in a factory making automotive parts and our employee leadership is very relaxed about having music on while you're working so I figured this would be perfect for my station!I have two things to mention before I say anything else ---First. It took me a while to figure out I had to hold down the power button to get the bluetooth to work which I thought was a little weird because I had just assumed it would automatically search for bluetooth devices.Second. My workplace is VERY loud. The presses are about the size of semi-truck trailers and all that machinery makes a lot of noise.With that being said I am very satisfied with the volume this little speaker can reach. I usually have to have it up all the way but I get enough volume to fill my station with music and I can actually understand and jam to it. Now it is not loud enough for anyone else in my bay to hear it but for regular home use one could presumable EASILY fill an entire room with music or whatever else you're listening to.I wouldn't recommend this speaker to somebody looking to make quick presentations though because it's just not THAT loud.Rated 4 stars because I felt it was a little pricey for what you get.Quality build, decent product, but I'm just not sure this is worth $60.The battery life only being about 3 hours is my main complaint.I often find myself wishing I had just pitched in the extra $40 for the Flip but I am a special circumstance!For regular/personal use in environments that aren't extremely loud like construction yards or factories -- this little guy will work great!
summary: Overall Great Product but not PERFECT!

reviewText: I looked at a wide variety of small, reasonably priced speakers. I settled on this one after reading other reviews. It gives lots of high quality sound and is so easy to use. The blue tooth connection was easy and can be set up on more than one iPhone, iPad or whatever. I've used it at dance classes and the teachers were amazed at its sound quality and ease of use. I would highly recommend it for portable music wherever you go.

Got the typical good service you can expect from Amazon. This speaker works and sounds even better than I hoped it would...love it! Going to buy about another one so I can daisy chain them...highly recommend!
Works perfectly in an area where I'm unable to get reception in the car as in upstate Vermont.  Love it!
Worked perfectly out of the box! Nice because the speaker did not have to be close to the iPhone to work well. Would buy it again in a heartbeat.
Have to admit, when I saw how small it was I was sure it couldn't possibly meet my expectations. Wrong! For its size, the sound quality is awesome. Love it!

I absolutely love this speaker and I use it all the time. It easily fits in a backpack or purse. We've taken it to the beach, the lake, camping, etc. and people are always impressed by the sound it puts out. I also use it quite a bit while cleaning or doing chores in my apartment, and it is loud enough to hear it well in the three rooms (medium-sized bedroom, small living room and kitchen). I was skeptical about the price, since it is so small, but it definitely is worth it.

Use this thing all the time, costs a bit more than some of the others but as the old saying goes " you get what you pay for". Sound is very good for such a small speaker and battery life is excellent.Just buy it!

It's unbelievable what a great big sound comes from this little speaker. If you're the type that needs directions on how to set up and use gadgets forget this. The only instructions are in drawn picture format and include things like a finger drawn about to touch a button. No explanation for what will happen when you do as pictured. I'm the adventurous type and managed to get mine going in just a few minutes.

Incredible sound with suprising bass for such a small speaker. I purchased this speaker with the hopes of using its aux out to connect my devices to my larger speakers, works flawlessly especially when you consider how much bluetooth dongles typically cost. Highly recommended!
summary: The Best Bluetooth Speaker I've Yet Found

reviewText: Got this for my son so he could connect to his phone while at work.  He works at a cell phone store which is where we got the idea but Amazon's price was better.  He loves it.  Listens to it all the time.  Great sound quality for a little device.

Pretty loud and clear. Nice bass. Only things I don't like is I wish the aux cable fit better in the back so it sat on the surface evenly, an actual battery percentage would be nice. And depending on the song and how loud it is there may be some little sound distortions.
summary: Lacks some things that would be nice

reviewText: This little speaker puts out good sound for its small size.  It easily connected via Bluetooth to our iPhones and Windows phones.  We are really happy with this speaker and feel it's a good value.

Use this little speaker often - both with Bluetooth or the cord. Great battery life and surprisingly good volume. I put it in my pocket and ran a 5K in a Halloween costume with corresponding music. It was a hit!
Love this speaker, works great and is very durable. I like how you can link them together via the jack cable.

My son wanted this as a Christmas present (which we had late in January).  His eyes lit up when he opened it.  Within minutes it was hooked wirelessly to his Samsung phone and the music blasted all night long as we gathered around the table playing games.  Everyone loved the sound.  I need to get one now for my Samsung phone.

I work outdoors in a cherry picker. Waited for something like this for a LONG time.Worked immediately out of box. Charges quickly. Sound is crisp and loud enough. Very few cut outs , even being within inches of heavy electrical and wifi equipment on telephone poles. Highly recommended for fellow utility workers who are tired of having to crank the windows down and the radio volume up to get a decent outdoor soundtrack.

I bought this for my husband for father's day.  I did some research online and narrowed it down to this specific unit.  I called Best Buy and the one near my house had two in some discount rack.  I scooped it up for $35.  It sounds great with my husbands android phone (the whole reason I bought it) and as a bonus it manually hooks up to my old ipod that I use for my music.  I guess he'll have to share. lol
Amazingly good, clear sound quality and a decent enough bass considering the size. Not much distortion at high volume levels either. Worth every penny.

This little speaker is freaking incredible.  The sound is surprisingly good compared to other portable bluetooth speakers and with a friendly price tag.  You can also daisy chain multiple speakers together to make for an impressive sound.  The only issue that I have encountered with this speaker is the occasional bluetooth connectivity issue... but it is always resolved within a short amount of time, and there is always the headphone connection that always works.The little loop at the top is perfect for hanging on things.  I use it to clip on to my backpack while I'm biking so that I don't have to wear headphones.  It makes for a great bike gang party day.  Big thumbs up for this product.

Very cool to be able to use this on my sound system to play Pandora music and control it from my tablet of phone. I bought it to have sound at demonstrations with a computer and everyone is always amazed at the quality and volume coming out of this little thing. Great product.
summary: Amazing features, amazing sound in a small package

reviewText: Extremely easy to operate and to connect w/using your bluetooth device. The sound is full & rich w/ample bass. Surprisingly powerful for such a small speaker. Definitely gives the Beats Pill a run for its money...w/o spending any!

Sound was amazing from this little guy. Did have some problems pairing with the Bluetooth, and also with the connection. Might be a faulty product. Returning as we speak for an easy exchange to a great customer service at World Wide Stereo.

Hands down the best portable lightweight, good looking excellent sound quality speaker I have EVER bought! First product review I've ever written on Amazon and I'm only writing it because this speaker has completely exceeded my expectation! In hindsight, I would have happily paid more for it. Very good value for money.
summary: Best value for money! AND it looks and sounds great!!!!

reviewText: Its the size of a hockey puck, but is louder and sounds clearer than speakers 4/5 times it's size and for half the price.. (Although i bought a used one for $30 here) I have nothing bad to say about this speaker, it fills a small to medium sized bedroom up with sound. It can't go head to head with larger speakers, it is not nearly as loud or as clear my other speakers (Bose Sounddock 3 and Zeppelin Air) but what do you expect at a fraction of the price and size!  it is definitely one of my favorite speakers. It is what it is, a small portable speaker, probably the best $30 i've spent on amazon!
summary: Wow... it all i can say

reviewText: This little speaker carries excellent sound at a nice volume! I get lots of comments from people within hearing distance and they can't believe how good it sounds, especially after hearing it's only $50!The battery life is excellent, I think I get about 7 plus hours on a charge and it charges pretty quick as well!Enjoy!

First, I should note that I suspect the seller shipped me a previously sold/returned unit since the box was missing the speaker pouch.  After 10 minutes of attempting to pair this speaker to a Galaxy S5, I finally got them to connect.  Unfortunately no audio was transmitted to the speaker.  I disconnected, spent another 10 minutes trying to pair them, gave up on it, and then checked the mini-jack connection since that is the primary way I intended to use it.  The wired connection worked, but the sound quality isn't great.  I understand that's it's a small speaker with minimal power, but do yourself a favor and step up to the ~$100 level if you want a portable wireless speaker.  Much better options to choose from at that price point.

Was desapointed on the sound performance since several review shown better appreciation then mine. If you like mid to high base performance, don't buy this product. Even BEAT small BeatBox (that have lower review rate) sound better to me.
summary: Less then expected per general review on the net.

reviewText: I got this speaker because my Google Nexus 7 FHD's speakers were okay, but wanted something I could use to increase its volume, especially when I throw a party. By all means, this is not comparable to heavy grade speakers that should be hooked up to a PA system, but its sound quality will fill the main area of an apartment. Overall tone for bass and treble are great, so I'm pretty satisfied with my choice!

Great little speaker!!! Easy to set up & quite loud for the environment I work in. Lasts about 6 hours on a full charge but I plug it in at the half way point of an 8 hour shift. And the price isn't bad either. Definitely a great buy!!!
I bought it one of my friends had one and so i had to have it works great. I get to use it when my kids let. Me lol. Its a must have for pool yardwork or just wanting to llisten to music
advertised as up to over 30 hours , i don't get 6 hours . not loud enough to do anything except sit next to speaker if you want to hear anything .

First off, I'm not comparing this speaker to anything else. I haven't heard anything else in this category.I've read it doesn't get loud enough or distorts at higher volumes, which I have not noticed. While it won't rattle walls or windows, it does get loud enough in a room to annoy others in the house.If it doesn't get loud enough, I'd suggest getting a speaker with a driver larger than 1.57 inches (40mm), or an amp that puts out more than 2.7 watts, or both.I listen to mostly rock; from Aerosmith to ZZ Top, including  Godsmack, Disturbed, and Pink Floyd, among many others, and it handles all quite well.Here's the cons:Charging cord is only 15 1/2 inches-From tip of connecter to tip of connecter. The cord itself is 12 3/4 inchesLinking cord is only 12 inches from body to tip of connecter. The cord itself is 10 7/8 inches......Both of these issues are easily & cheaply overcome.If you're not using the linking cord, the unit will not sit flat on a table or whatever because the connector stored in the bottom of the unit is thicker than it's resting spot.If size matters-The unit size is 3.25 inches by 1.56 inches (83mm x 39mm)Hope this helps

I compared this Bluetooth speaker to the HMDX Audio HX-P230GY for music and voice on my Samsung Galaxy Note II. I was pleased with the Micro's smoothness and detail with whatever program material I feed it compared to the louder but less pleasing HMDX Jam. Vocals are clear and music has excellent balance of tonality and detail. At full volume you won't get the advertised five hours of uninterrupted audio but what you will get is a very enjoyable listening experience. The controlled bass response coming out of something this size is remarkable and it never gets in the way of other instruments or vocals. My only nit is the hockey puck form factor with the less than useful integrated hook on its side, but placing it flat on the surface or hanging it in the air still results in pleasurable audio wherever you go. Bluetooth connection is solid and reliable. The JBL Micro Wireless is roughly twice the cost of the HMDX Jam but the performance is well worth the extra bucks. Try one, or both as I did and hear the difference for yourself.

This little speaker is Great. I have quite a few, but this one at its low price and weight and size is really the bonus. It's got a good sound, not heavy on the bass really, but still nice clarity and sound. It's also a Great speaker for connecting to other devices hence controlling the device using your personal phone, comp, iPad,etc.....since it has an Output plug. Most other speakers that have an output jack or plug are much more expensive, larger, and heavier. This ones great for traveling or for your garage or studio, and works great connect to your stereo and control it using Bluetooth.
Nice performance for the money, I use it in the office, on the golf course and traveling.  Excellent value and quality for the money!
This is a nice lil speaker, I was suprised at the sound it put out and the bass was very good. I would recommend this product.

I'm not a speaker expert.I wanted something to plug my phone into on the back deck while we bbq and hang outside.My expectations were not terribly high going into this purchase.But the sound quality is rich for something small.It was a happy surprise.

reviewerName: M. L. Morita "in the middle of the Pacific"
reviewText: For the price, and the size, this Bluetooth speaker was worth the price and a rich sound from a small product. Looked into other Bluetooth speakers, bigger and more expensive, but read a good product review on this speaker and took a chance. So far, so good. Happy with the purchase. Won't be happy if the product fails, or fails from consumer failure, (I brake it). Met and surpassed my expectations.

Awesome little speaker.  Sounds great.  Bluetooth pairing (and changing paired devices) is a breeze, unlike some other BT speakers.  Ability to chain multiple speakers together is very nice touch.  Bought this for our 11yo.  Liked it so much we got one for her little sister's birthday too.

This thing has amazing sound and lasts for far longer than I even need it to. Perfect for outdoor activities when you want to listen to music without bringing a set of speakers with you. Bluetooth connects flawlessly.
Unbelievable sound out of this little thing. I was skeptical when I ordered this but my mother swore to me that it was awesome and it really is. Blows my iphone and ipad speaker away

I wasn't expecting a lot for the price, but this little speaker is great.  The sound is amazing and it has a pretty good range.  The setup is very easy and I set it up with both my iPad and Galaxy S4, both with great results.

When I first opened the box I thought this is not going to be what I want. But, once it was plugged into the IPod I was really shocked.  The sound was much louder than I had anticipated.  We have used it outdoors on the patio and in the house and it can be heard loud and clear.  I will definitely recommend this speaker!!!
Great bang for the buck.  Size and shape makes its portability top notch.  Nice crisp sound, decent base for a speaker this size, price is right.

This little speaker is remarkable. The sounf that comes out reminds of when Bose first hit the market back in the 60's. It is amazing how much base comes from this little speaker. Not like a 4 foot tall woofer but still good for its size. It connected easily to all my devices via bluetooth and I'm very happy with my purchase.
Great speaker very loudspeaker great for the price. Press down on the power button need to reconnect. Speaker will Fit in your pocket.

Bought these for vacation..... Worked perfect on the beach. Base and treble worked perfect for 70s and 80s music....and 90s too. All through pandoraPros:good strong soundEasy bluetooth sync - no delays (iPhone 5, 4 IPad 2/3)Battery lasted for almost 6hoursAttached headphone jack for direct connect to iPhone worked perfect when I didn't want to use BluetoothDecent price - at $50Sounds good sitting flat on table - picks up good base vs standing upCons:Not much...Might buy another for full stereo like sound

This is the coolest tech toy I have bought in a while.  It is smaller than a hockey puck, classy enough style to keep in your office (if you're one of those types), and sound is awesome!  Everyone who hears this is always pleasantly surprised.  Simple to pair with your device.  Built in cord for non-bluetooth devices.  Cool blue light shows through the front when on.If it has a weakness, of course it's the bass.  This speaker is SMALL, and if you're expecting booty-shaking, body-bumping bass, then you're delusional.  Not going to come from any brand in a speaker this size.  If you've got the dough and can tolerate something bigger, then splurge for the Bose ($300) and you'll have your bass.  For the size and price, this speaker delivers.  Highly recommend.
Using for a radio on construction sites (inside). Works well; not much weight to it but placement on the right surface improves overall sound. Satisfied with it.

Can not be happier with this little monster. Unbelievable sound from a small "puck" speaker. We had a Altec Lansing puck speaker that we loved but ran across one of there and it blows the AL out of the water. We needed the Bluetooth so the AL is now relegated to the garage. We loved this speaker so much we bought 2 and then bought one for my brother and sister for Christmas. Seriously, if you can get to a Staples and hear one, you'll buy one.

I already had the last two versions of JBL corded digital device speakers, which I have used for several years.  They are great little speakers, but they have to be physically attached to my iPhone or Macbook to play.  When I saw that they now have a Bluetooth, I jumped at buying one.  It is even better than the last one.  Besides being wireless, as others have mentioned, the case is formed so that it can stand on its side and pointed directionally; very nice.  Secondly, it has a little handle for carrying or hanging, very nice, also.  Thirdly, you can plug it in like an iPhone or iPad to charge.  Much better than going through AAA batteries.So, a great new evolution to an already fine product.
summary: First One Was Good, Second One Was Great, This One is Superb

reviewText: I have bought three of these speakers now.  One for me at home, one at the office, and one for my husband.  The sound is great, absolutely no complaints.  I suppose if I were an audiofile I would think differently, but I would have also spend a bunch more money for something that I just want to use with my phone out in the garage or wherever.
summary: Great size and sound for the price

reviewText: This wonderful Bluetooth speaker from JBL defies all preconceived notions you had about little speakers. I tried this one vs the JBL Flip and I can honestly say that the sound difference is negligible. The device itself is about the size of a hockey puck (slightly larger) and weighs almost nothing. The sound quality is clear, bass is adequate, and the volume can be brought all the way up without suffering any loss of sound quality. For me the only minor drawback is no speaker phone capability for incoming calls but that is only for those of us who have a bad speaker phone on the cell phone. I don't so I don't care. If you are looking for a small, long lasting, portable device to listen to music or other media then you need look no further. For the price, this is the best available value to be found. Simply graceful, elegant, sleek and amazing performance for such a little device.
summary: Little device packs a POWERFUL punch!

reviewText: We've all done it -- play music from your phone or iPad over the little internal speakers.  That's certainly better than nothing, but not much.This compact speaker never ceases to impress.  The bluetooth is easy to configure.  The cord to attach via the head phone jack is neatly tucked away and accessible if needed.MOST IMPRESSIVE -- the sound.  I have a larger, wired speaker I used to take with me when I would travel.  No more.  This JBL is smaller, lighter, and sounds great!  It's like having actual box speakers.
summary: Big sound, small package, great battery life

reviewText: I've been through a bunch of this type of speaker. JBL is by far the best sound so far. Easy to use, too. The sound from its big brother JBL is even better than the Micro.
Very happy with these speakers.  I shopped around quite a lot before I decided on them.  Sound is crisp and loud enough for what they are intended for.  I recommend them.

This speaker is the best of its kind. I also own the Philips SoundShooter and the Jam 2 wireless speakers. The JBL Micro is the only one of the three that I continue to use due to its superior quality and durability. The other two brands were basically of disposable quality by comparison.

This little speaker I bought because I wanted something smaller than my JBL Charge that I also own so I could clip it to my belt loop and use while I walk around to do my inventory at work. Although small in size, it has good volume and a very clear crisp sound. I also like the built in 3.5 auxillary cord that winds around the speaker when not used. It pairs up easily to my Iphone 5 and IPad 2. The little handle at the top allows you to attach a carabiner and attach it to something for listening. I also like the fact that you can daisy chain several together. It's a great little speaker and would recommend it to anyone who wants a small bluetooth speaker with great volume for its size.
Lots of power in a small speaker. Sounds great, smaller than what I thought it would be, but worth it.

Always enjoyed the JBL brand and this little speaker Lives UP.  Bass is Smooth with zero distortion.  Plenty of charge time and BT distance.  Just wish the top Loop was a little bigger to hang on things....

This little gem is perfect. I can turn on Pandora on my phone and take this little speaker anywhere and it is great. I bought it to use on my deck. Worth the price. I also gave it to my neighbor to try who is a musician with a much better knowledge of sound quality and he loved it as well. Perfect for out doors or anywhere you want to go.
It's inexpensive but sounds and works great! Pairs easily with my iPhone and iPad. A no brainer for anyone looking for an inexpensive Bluetooth speaker

I purchased this speaker for my wife as a birthday gift after we saw and heard our neighbor's on a trip to the. Beach.  This little speaker puts out a lot of surprisingly good sound.  The Bluetooth feature is a real bonus. Haven't really put the battery to the test yet.
summary: A lot of speaker for the money.

reviewText: I expected too much out of this product. The bass was lacking for me but that's probably because I crave bass. I ended up buying the bose soundlink mini, which is the bomb!
this speaker got a nice sound quality but the bass is not as much as stronger as i expected .
summary: nice sound but bass is not what i expect

reviewText: I'm blown away at the quality of sound that comes through this little speaker. I can't believe this was only $50. Was sold on the fact that it also serves as a bluetooth dongle. Just wow.

The thing is the size of a hockey puck, but puts out comparable sound to a full sized sound system!  I wanted a speaker for my Iphone that I could locate by my office door to block sound and operate remotely.  This connects by Bluetooth and is easy to use.  It works from 25 feet away through a closed door.  If I need to mute it or change songs, I can do it from my fingertips.  I am very pleased.
Great sound from such a small device.  Easily portable.  Recommended.

Lot's of clear sound from such a small speaker.  I bought this on sale through amazon and am only disappointed that I didn't buy many more at that price and give them as gifts.  More than enough needed for an office(what I bought it for.)  This little guy is well built, small, light, but puts out enough clear sound to surprise anyone that hears and sees it.  Battery life is also excellent.

I recently bought several portable Bluetooth speakers and really like the JBL over the others.  Great sound quality for a speaker that fits in the palm of my hand.  Fine quality mid- and upper-range.  There isn't a whole lotta bass nor is it a stereo speaker, but you'll be hard-pressed to find better quality sound for the money.

This thing is unbelievably loud for the size.For this price, value is definitely there.Battery life is awesome, and sound quality really good for the size/price.I'm glad I didn't spend $250 on a larger device, because this one just fits my needs perfectly, it's very compact and mobile, and again battery lasts a very long time.
The product is excelent, speaker is loud.I put it on my bag on my mountain bike rides and the sound is just perfect.

I received this as a Christmas present, and can't believe what a great product it is.  My wife and I travel frequently, and I always bring a small travel speaker so we can enjoy music while siting out on our balcony.  Until now, I've been using an Altec Lansing iM237, which has good sound and is reasonably portable.  But comparing the two side by side, the audio quality of the JBL is indistinguishable from the Altec Lansing, and it's less than half the size.  The speaker paired instantly with my iPad, and the Bluetooth range is amazing. It has a rechargeable battery, so that's one less replacement AAA battery I have to take, and it can be recharged from any standard 5V charger (the same one I take to recharge my iPad, iPhone, etc.). The JBL Micro Wireless is definitely my new favorite travel speaker - I can't recommend it more highly.

I love the sound quality and portability.  I even got family members to purchase it.  I have used it in a hospital, in a rental car , in a hotel and at home. It works will with the Bible on my Ipad and with music.

If you're looking for a fairly-priced, wireless Bluetooth speaker that will add a lot off ooomph to your iPad/iPod/other mobile device for **non-critical listening**, look no further.The volume will surprise you. It's perfect for listening to podcasts/music while you're in the shower, or otherwise busy around the house.  It knocks the pants off the built-in speakers in whatever portable device you have and it's supreme portability makes it super-convenient.I was shopping for the JBL Flip but couldn't find one anywhere in New York. I reluctantly got this instead but I'm a happy customer.
summary: Works as advertised... and will surprise you

reviewText: Connected to my Samsung G3 right away. Easy to operate. Great sound quality! Easy to use!!! I highly recommend this product!AAAA+++++++++++

Surprisingly good sound from this little speaker. Always like JBL products and this is added to the list. Was looking at something to take to the pool in the summer but leave my tablet in the house and yet not have to string out wires or use ear phones...this is almost perfect. I reviewed other speakers and decide on this one, good choice. The only drawback I guess but it's not the speakers fault is the limited distance for the Bluetooth signals @ 25 feet, keep that in mind when tagging this around, still good though.

Easy to connect to my phone, brilliant clear sound, just exactly what I was looking for. Big thumbs up on this little speaker! Would make a wonderful gift as well. Would recommend this one to everyone....
But the signal gets randomly lost even when my iTouch is within inches and there are no other Bluetooth devices around.

I have been looking for a bluetooth portable speaker for a while and finally decided on this JBL. For the price, you can't beat it. It syncs easily, the sound it pretty full with surprisingly warm tones. I use my iPad or iPhone to play music and then just have to bring this speaker along with me. Great to use with a laptop too. This pushes out enough sound and can fill a small room nicely. It comes with a felt bag which I found can be used to house the speaker when at the beach to keep the sand out while letting the sound through. Thumbs up!

My daughter wanted a wireless speaker so that she could be upstairs with her 15 month old and continue to listen to her music. Since I was not familiar with the technology, I had to really trust that the JBL name and the description were what she was looking for. It was a complete success, it was easy to connect and has really great sound. For a small little speaker it sounds just amazing. I even used my Amex reward points to pay for it so the price was right, too!
summary: Just what she was looking for.

reviewText: I agree with all of the positive comments. Small size, good battery life, easy to connect to Mac, straightforward bluetooth pairing, sounds as good as my iHome wireless iW1 speakers. I have purchased two - one as a gift for nephew/niece before asking their parent's permission and one for personal use.My question - how do you get the audio cable (not the USB cable which obviously disconnects) tightly wound back in to the unit. I can not figure it out. A minor inconvenience, but like most "packaging" once it is opened there is no way to restore it to its original configuration - the cable just hangs there.Suggestions are welcome. Thank you.
I didn't know how small this speaker is, it fits in the palm of my hand so I underestimated the BIG sound that would come out of this thing!  I love this little thing it's truly incredible!!
This speaker Is Awesome! The Sound Is amazing For The Size of The Unit. No Distortion. I Couldn't Be More Pleased!

Good sound for micro speaker. Bluetooth does not drops & range is good. Extra audio  connector is very useful especially if you are using it with DAC or older devices which does not support blue-tooth connectivity.

I have bought several Harman Kardon speakers over the past several years.  They are quality products.  This speaker is no exception.  It produces a rich sound, has a long-life battery, and the wifi gives me up to 30 feet of coverage.  I can highly recommend this speaker.
Great sound for both music and audio books. Connects immediately to my Android phone. Charge lasts for hours. Great value.
Great long lasting battery life. Big sound in a very portable size. Easy to connect and great looking. Not the cheapest but better than most by far.
summary: Very Portable With A Great Sound

reviewText: it was a gift for my husband and he loves it. Great sound.Nice size and easy to travel with.

Just recently received my JBL Micro Wireless Bluetooth Speaker and was impressed by two things. First, I was taken aback by how small it was. When I opened the shipping box and saw this tiny little box inside, I immediately thought I had made a mistake. I had that sinking feeling that I had just been taken. The I turned it on and played music for the first time. WOW! I'm blown away over how so much high-quality sound could come from such a small package. Truly impressive. I called my wife and daughter into the room right away to show off my purchase, and have since ordered two more to give as gifts.The most impressive thing is the quality of the low-end. It loses some of its oomph when you listen to it outdoors around other ambient sound and no reflective surfaces, but so does every other audio product. I took it to a friend's pool party and everyone there who heard it was impressed, too. This little bugger will be great at the beach in a few weeks.It was easy to set up, has a simple button and dial for controls, and comes with a handy travel pouch. One thing I missed in the description and other reviews is that you can daisy-chain several speakers together to get even more sound. Great idea!The only thing I wish it had was a standard wall charger. Of course, you can plug the USB charger cord into any wall adapter and it works fine. I just know that will be the first thing I don't have when I need it.In all, a great product. Kudos, JBL!
summary: Impressive Sound from a Small Package

reviewText: Very good quality sound, attractive and easy to move from place to place. The volume level does not go very high but for "normal" purposes this poses no problem.

I really like this little speaker.  It's just what we needed for tunes in the backyard or campsites.  The bass really thumps!  I would definitely recommend this product.  And I think it's a great price.  Easy to charge and very portable.
People are amazed when we show them where the sound is coming from! Great product good sound and size! You can hang it from pretty much any where!
Very good sound. Easy to charge. Great battery life. Size is perfect; small enough to be portable but not too small to get lost. It was a gift and he loves it. Great purchase!!
loud enough, good quality product! makes my laptop or my cel phone very loud! If you are looking for a speaker louder than this then get your self a stereo :)
Small and sounds great!  I keep in the console in my car, and have it ready whenever we want to listen to tunes while travelling.  Not the loudest device, but for it's size, it's very nice.

Nice added bonus that it includes wired for usage and daisy chaining to other speakers (have not tried that yet).I was a bit concerned about not having replaceable batteries but it really holds a charge well and is supported by micro-USB plug.

Overall this little thing works great!  Excellent sound, definitely better than what comes from my iPad.  At louder volumes the heavier bass sounds distort though.  Bluetooth connection was simple and works great.

I did not buy this off of amazon but I wished I 'd had caused I paid more for mine.Anyhow, this is an awesome sounding speaker, my son bought one for use with hisSamsung Galaxy 4 phone, (Bluetooth). I was so amazed by the quality of sound that I wentback to the store and bought one for myself. Now my daughter wants one so...(Christmas Present).Easy to carry around or put on a lanyard or just set it on its small flat edge at the bottom.A full charge will last approx. 6 hrs. It beats all other small speakers. Don't waste your time or money.I say buy it,  you'll love it.

This little guy is sweet....I read the reviews I watched the YouTube reviews and figured I'll give it a shot. I love this little guy. I mainly bought this for Fathers day for my self. See I got this BBQ Apron from a website called thinkgeek.com called the Tactical Apron (guys you have to check this out. Ladies your guy will love it) and I bought this speaker to fit into one of the pouches so I can listen to my music when moving around (inside/outside the house) without headphones and this works great. I find myself using this little speaker more than my other docks. When I move around in the house I just pick it up or hook it on my belt loop with a carabiner.

My co-worker had this speaker and she brought it into the office.  I couldn't believe how nice it sounded and how loud it could play.  I bought one for my son for his birthday and my Granddaughter for Christmas. My daughter bought one for her daughter and  I asked and received one for Christmas. In addition, my nieces bought one for my sister and my other co-worker bought one for her son and daughter who are in college. Need I say more?  We all love it.  Love the size, the clarity, the convenience.  I can't believe how many times I have used it in just about a month.
It's got such strong sound, although it's not great in noisy areas i.e. it doesnt drown out sound well.  But I would highly recommend it.
This was a gift for my boyfriend and i buy it because i had the jbl flip and both are amazing...the sound for this one its perfect for his size. I recommend it!!

I bought this for my wife. She likes to listen to her music and cranks the volume on her iPhone, which can't be good.. This little hockey puck has room filling sound and lasts on a charge for some serious hours.  A very nice speaker that connects blue tooth fast and easy. I am looking forward to using it on our vacation to listen to music on the balcony of our condo.  If there's a better speaker for this price I seriously doubt it.It seems to be getting better the longer we use it. Break in period?
Nice sound, not fantastic. Has a little more base than most speakers this size. Overall you get what you pay for.
This thing sounds amazing.The bluetooth is cool.The price is right.I wouldn't change a thing.Perfect little portable speaker.Enough said.
Wasn't very loud compared to other brands I have tried. I did like that the audio cord was attached to it.
Very portable, light and with decent sound. My 1 year old daughter totallly loves it and carries it around as her personal radio. Bluetooth works flawlessly.

Very good quilty. If you are looking for blue tooth make sure it  the label day "Blue Tooth" I bought the wrong one 1st time.

This little speaker is small enough to carry along with you to anywhere you go. It is easy to use and connect your device to. The sound quality is awesome and is definitely high quality. No negatives so far. 10/10. Would recommend to anyone looking for a travel speaker.

This speaker sounds great. After the package arrived I opened it and was almost disappointed. I looked at it and thought, "this thing is tiny! How can they charge that much for this thing?" I quickly turned it on and connected to bluetooth to my phone. As soon as it started playing, I was blown away. This thing sounded great and filled the room with sound. reviewText: I'll preface my remarks by saying this is merely my "opinion," or perception.  Others may have very different reactions (apparently more positive ones), which will be affected by source material (vocals vs. instrumentals, guitar vs. piano, combo vs. symphony orchestra).I have yet to find a "mini" speaker that delivers the audio my ears require for listening to jazz and classical music.  (I'm so fastidious, I'll disqualify certain recordings from consideration on the basis of a recording engineer whose representation of the piano is always a distorted version of a "real" piano.I want "real," full sounds, with "true" bass (not the artificially "enhanced" bass frequencies of the middle register.  I know there are speakers out their capable of passing my "test" (I begin with the bass of Paul Chambers on "So What" from Miles Davis' "Kind of Blue" and proceed from there to solo piano and then complete orchestra (from Bach to Bartok).  And I'm looking for a "traveling" unit that will slide as smoothly into my shoulder bag as an 11" Mac Air (don't use a cover for maximum utiltiy and lightness).I'm a huge JBL / Harman-Kardon fan, and I had high hopes that this product would be a notable exception to all of the other frequency-challenger, underpowered "mini" speakers that I had tried (look for a few soon on Amazon).  Instead, the JBL Micro was too weak to satisfy even my wife (whose musical tastes are more broad than mine).I don't want to carry a "box-shaped" unit on trips much less up and down the stairs.  But I found one small unit that slipped into my bag and delivered enough sound to fill the house: the Motorola EQ7 (made by JBL).  It has not one but 4 transducers along with a heavy magnet and Blu Tooth, and its flat, "omlet" shape makes it fairly easy to slip into a should bag along with a laptop.  Unfortunately, the speaker has been discontinued now for 2-3 years, so an interested party needs to search for good used or refurbished units.My only caveats about the EQ7 (don't even give a 2nd look at the EQ5, which I also happen to have) is that stacking 4 AA batteries into it for portable use requires some practice and patience.  Also, the BluTooth can be a bit reluctant to "pair," especially with equipment made after 2010.  Finally, after a couple of hourss, I definitely begin to feel its weight[---which must be twice as heavy as my computer.Consequently, I was quick to jump on to the comparable speaker not only manufactured by, but sold exclusively as, JBL itself.  It's the JBL On Tour iBT Bluetooth speaker which, like the EQ7, has a total of 4 transducers (2" speakers) but is noticeably lighter and thinner ithan the EQ7.  The bass frequencies of the On Tour iBT are not as strong and clear as those of the EQ7, but the sound of a piano is as "open," spacious and transparent, as the EQ7.  Although the user has to deal with the same "battery problem" and an extra button, the On Tour has become such a congenial "travel partner" that, when I saw that it too was being discontinued, I immediately purchased two more.  JBL would replace it with a subsequent speaker called "The Flip," which I immediately had to return after hearing its distorted (to this pianist's ears) reproduction of the sound of a piano.  It's a great, dynamic company, and it can be hard to keep up with their constantly changing products (though their Harman Kardon Soundsticks have changed little since their first appearance 15 years ago (thankfully!). Regardless, the JBL name has always signified "high quality"--at least since I bought my first speaker from them in the early '70s (a bookshelf speaker with a 14" woofer that I continue to use).Again, the above is merely one person's experience and opinion. For some reason, people tend to be especially passionate about their preferred speaker-even at extremely low price levels of under a hundred. I respect their opinions.  I've read glowing reviews of products that subsequently disappointed me.  But I never blamed the reviewer--unless it later became apparent that I had been misled by a paid hack's "promo" piece for the company's product.
summary: Weak and inadequate to my ears

reviewText: The sound on this little speaker is just amazing! I was very impressed by it. J BL is known for their speakers and they definitely have a winner here.

Since the late 60s I've always purchased JBL speakers, their sound and my ears matched nicely since I couldn't afford Bose, they were quite large in size then. The sound on this portable device is great, clear, precise, no noise distortion, it easily syncs with your Bluetooth device. It's pretty loud for it's size. You can still plug it into the ear phone jack of a non Bluetooth device or connect to other speakers.When I was shopping Amazon had a good price on these.The one con: it has no stand for sitting it in a room to project out instead of up. It would be nice if it had a little flip out stand like a picture frame.Caution when purchase: Amazon sales both the plug JBL portable speaker that plugs into your device's ear phone jack and the wireless Bluetooth speaker. I made the mistake and had to exchange for the later.
summary: Love JBL since the late 60s. This is for the Bluetooth wireless speaker.

reviewText: No disapointments here.Small unit - I was a bit surprised by how small it was, however, as positively surprised with the sound.perfect for a portable unit and we have used it to share music around the campfire and outside deck socials for up to 15 people.Enjoy

This thing is great. I am very impressed with the acoustics anywhere I have listened to this speaker. Obviously some places are better than others, but it has outperformed anything I thought a speaker this size could do. A must have for people who travel a lot! The people I have shown this to have been stunned. Sounds better than some, only heard a few, of the more expensive (~$100) ones I have heard.
While not for audiophiles, we use it while traveling with our cell phones and iPads.  This speaker is far superior when listening to music or talk radio on our cell phone's speakers.

This little $56 portable speaker is really AWESOME for me while I'm traveling!I Love music and I was skeptical about decent sound coming out of a palm sized speaker.  But I bought a JBL Speaker myself after hearing it in a business meeting when we didn't have speakers available to play a training video.  I was shocked with the quality and volume this tiny speaker can deliver to a fairly large conference room. Impressed.I had seen all the advertising for the BEATS PILL so I bought one of those too (on black Friday deal for $149 at Staples) so I could compare side by side.The BEATS PILL gets the nod for clearer highs, but this little JBL holds it's own for the classic rock/pop music (at the volumes I enjoy) without the horrible distortion most small speakers put out at higher volumes!  It also delivers great bass response for it's size.It is truly light and absolutely acceptable to toss into my backpack when I'm traveling.  It has Bluetooth connectivity and works great with my iPhone 5s.The JBL speaker comes with an attached 3.5 connector which tucks nicely into a slot on the bottom of the speaker in case you need it.  No more carrying an extra cord with to make that connection - I use the cord to connect the speaker to my laptop as an external computer speaker.  It also has a port for input of a 3.5 connector on the side of the speaker - allowing you to "chain" speakers together for "Stereo Sound" (which I will be doing when I get my second one).WELL DESIGNED.  I really do LOVE it.NOTE: The BEATS Pill has extra features like speaker phone capabilities, but I really don't need that so back it goes.  Also it didn't automatically connect to my iPhone each time I turned it like the JBL did.  Another comment: BEATS PRODUCTS ARE WAY OVER PACKAGED! Makes it very luxurious looking when unpacking the item but I'm sure that's adds significantly to their cost.  You could almost drive a truck over the box their products come in - not environmental friendly!buy one or two.  you won't be disappointed!If you just want 5 hours per charge of very acceptable sound this JBL Micro wireless speaker is great!
summary: LOVE IT so much I just bought a SECOND

reviewText: I recently purchased a JBL Charge and am very impressed with it.  Shortly after I got the Charge I received this little gem as a Christmas "stocking stuffer".  I really didn't expect much out of it, but was totally blown away with both the sound quality and the volume.  It sounded good right out of the box and the sound quality improved after several hours of listening.  My wife and I exercise several times a week in a large room. I set my iPhone to a pop dance station on Pandora and this speaker fills the room with good quality sound. The Bluetooth connection to my iPhone was flawless and the range is impressive.  This is a perfect travel speaker and we plan to use it extensively on an up-coming trip.At over 3" in diameter it is a little bigger than I expected, but it comes with a soft carrying pouch and fits easily into a vest pocket. I have not tried linking it with another speaker, but getting a little separation with two speakers would most certainly improve the sound quality.It does not come with a wall plug for charging, just a short cord with a mini jack at the speaker end and a USB plug on the other.  However, I have charged it from the wall charging unit that came with the JBL Charge (the speaker jack is the same), I have charged it from the USB port on the Charge while listening to that speaker and from my computer.  I have also charged it by plugging it directly into simple USB power adapters for both 110V AC and 12V DC with no problem.  I have not maxed out the charge time on this speaker, but can vouch for at least 3 hours of continuous play.
summary: A very powerful, very clear little speaker

reviewText: Well I've been using my JBL speaker for about 2 months now and its still just as great as when i opened it.Now, this isnt a subwoofer.So dont expect to knock pictures off the wall. But its loud enough to fill rooms and turn heads. Nobody believes that this much sound can be emitted by this one tiny speaker.Pairing with devices is simple. Hold the power button. Wait for a double beep. and the speaker should pop up on your Bluetooth device list. Select it, wait for the single beep, and your good to go.The range of connectivity is good. I left my phone in my room, took the speaker outside for a smoke break and there was no distortion or static cracks. Although if something blocks either the phone or speaker directly, there will be some feed back.This thing looks great, sounds great, a bit pricy but if you settle for less your gonna regret it. I've had many mini speakers already. This has to top em all.The only things i dont like are that the volume is a wheel. Pretty old school. Also you cant change tracks from the speaker. You have to change songs through your device. Also the AUX cord is great and all(daisy chain, storage space, playability for Bluetooth-less devices) , but, the way it snaps into the bottom of the speaker doesnt allow the speaker to lay flat on a surface. When it comes to speakers, an even surface is necessary for best quality sound. They could easily fix this by making the rubber lip beneath the speaker slightly thicker. Another thing i noticed was that when you daisy chain it, so that larger speakers can become bluetooth enabled, there is some loss of sound. Not much, but i have equalizers set. I.d preffer to leave them that way rather than adjusting it here and there.Would i recommend this? Yes, but maybe you'd have more fun with the JBL Flip..
Big for its tiny size!! This little guy produces awesome sound yet, its not overwhelming I use the blue tooth but I prefer to hook it up to AUX cable, I'm glad I got it.
Great quality sound. Bluetooth works awesome and is very handy.Realistically you have about 20-30ft where it works good. I use it as my boat speakers because of the bluetooth, and works really good

My main concern with this speaker was about how loud it was going to be given it's tiny size. It truly is pocket-sized (about the size of a man's palm) and I bought it to play videos which for one reason or another have very low sound and can't be heard when the computer's speakers are turned up to maximum. This is amazingly loud and good quality given the size and mid-range price. If volume is your main concern, this is a very good option.The other concerns I had about this was bluetooth connectivity. It connected to an Acer laptop PC running Windows 8 with a super cheap ($4.95) bluetooth dongle, but it isn't always consistent or immediate. Sometimes we have to plug and unplug the dongle. Sometimes we have to put the computer to sleep and wake it up. Eventually, it has always connected, but at times there is a delay of 20-30 seconds. I don't place the blame for this on the speaker, but on the cheap dongle. That being said, my Mac Mini with built-in bluetooth running OS 10.6.8 could not find the device whether I was booted into Windows XP or into the Mac OS.  I know the Bluetooth on the Mac is functional because it has been able to tether to keyboards before. I'm not sure what the problem is, but if you are using an old Mac with an older OS, you may want to consider this as a potential problem.Since the speaker was purchased primarily to be used with the PC, I've been using the cable for use with the Mac. This works well, but I have serious concerns about repeated use of this short, very delicate cable which is tightly wound into the base of the speaker. It is so tight that if you don't wind it up precisely correctly, you can't fit the plug back into it's pre-formed spot in the base without stretching it a little. Given how delicate it is, I think that any sort of pull on the cable is likely to break the connection sooner rather than later. I've only had this for several weeks, so I can't say anything has gone wrong yet, but I'm considering buying a second cheap set of speakers to keep permanently connected to the Mac to put off this possible issue. I'd like to have a functional cable in reserve should the bluetooth fail and I don't want to waste this potential repeatedly connecting and disconnecting the cable. Because I feel like I have to buy another product to safeguard this one due to this design with the cable, I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5.
summary: good sound for small speaker, very delicate cable

reviewText: Got it as a present for a friend. It produces a great sound, more than you would expect.Giving four stars because the form factor does not allow to set it right up so it stands in its side -- the feedback I got from this friend.It's better suited for use with a cell-phone rather than  with a laptop when watching movies during the travel, when you want the speaker to stand and face towards you.

reviewText: For $50.00 only, you can't expect too much. Small, beautiful color but the sound is not one of the best. I bought in the past better speakers from JBL. Not very satisfy.

I actually have to turn the volume down low to not disturb other hotel guest.Highly recommended.  Friends inquired about it and couldn't believe the sound it packed, especially for the price!

reviewText: I purchased this speaker so I could carry it with me when walking and listening to lectures, audio books, etc.  It allows all of those who are walking with me to listen too.Sometimes when I don't want to wear earbuds while walking or working out ( by myself in quiet gym or garage or park ) I'll use these.They are very loud, crisp and clear for lectures, talks, etc...Not recommeded for music.I carry it in my shirt or pants pocket or dangling from lanyard around my next when walking.Very loud, very clear, very crisp and I'm very pleased...

I purchased this product from another retailer & from the reviews I was hoping for the best.This was not it. First this was not loud enough at all. I paired it with my Samsung S2 & it seemed to be louder when I used the AUX compared to bluetooth. Honestly my speaker on my S2 was louder than the JBL Micro. I made sure the volume was up on both devises. Also at full volume there was a bit of distortion which no one likes. The battery lasted for about four hours before sounding worse as the battery got weaker. After that it completely stopped working with bluetooth & the wire. Another thing I didn't like but was convenient is the Aux wire is attached to the device. This is good to keep from loosing it but in time if the wire gets messed up (kink or tear) you are screwed because you can't replace it without replacing the whole unit.Bottom line I would not recommend this unless you don't like to hear your music.I also used this while I was in the yard & when about 12 to 15 feet away it was very hard to hear. I am sending this back & will be looking for a bluetooth speaker with more speakers & more watts. I will probably have to spend an extra $100. to get the quality I am looking for. In my experience 90% of the time you get what you payed for. I am considering the Jabra Soulmate,the Grace Digital ECOXGEAR or the Braven BRV-1. reviewText: Got one of these for free at a conference and was amazed by the sound quality, especially bass, from a device so small. I lost it on a trip and could not live without it. reviewText: Small size but Sound quite good,Anywhere, paring with many device is confuse. Package is good... Must have for traveller.

reviewText: This was the perfect gift for someone who is hard to buy for and the fact that it is rechargeable was an added bonus.

I've seen other bluetooth speakers that friends had bought and this blew most of them right out of the water. I say most because obviously the Jambox and other higher priced speakers have better bass and such, but way less portability. For this price range you can't beat the JBL Micro! reviewText: Clear sound and lots of bass. Can be hidden anywhere and played ALL DAY with one charge. A USB cord comes with it for charging but I use my cell phone charger (Samsung Galaxy) to recharge it fast. Two can be connected together with the attached audio cord but you can only wirelessly connect to one...at least that is the case with my Galaxy S4. I bought four.I will be using it with a projector for a portable presentation.My daughter uses hers in the locker room before basketball games to get the team hyped up for the game.My son uses his in his studio apartment and the sound fills the entire place...it's too loud.
The JBL delivers great clear sound. It was much louder than I expected especially for how small it was. It was very easy to hook up to bluetooth.
You will not be disappointed. The sound is amazing. I highly recommend this. Easy to use and you can bring it anywhere. If fills the entire room with sound.

This is the 4th Bluetooth Speaker I've bought, and it buries the competition by a significant margin.  One of the earlier Bluetooth speakers I bought was the Cambridge Soundworks Oontz, which by comparison, falls way behind the JBL.  The Oontz almost completely lacks in any of the lower frequencies, and doesn't greatly impress me in the rest of the sound spectrum.  On the other hand the JBL Micro Wireless Bluetooth speaker has better bass, and overall, a much more realistic sound spectrum.  Almost all smaller speakers, one buys, are going to be a compromise in some area.  To have the desired portability, obviously you can't put a 12" woofer in such a speaker, but what you can do is maximize the frequencies that a portable speaker system can produce.  JBL has done the best job so far.  No, it isn't stereo, but how much stereo affect can you expect from a speaker you can hold in the palm of your hand?  I read that one reviewer found that this speaker distorts.  Well, any speaker, driven too hard, will distort.  If you are driving a speaker that hard, you are in danger of blowing it's voice coil.  Obviously, it's unrealistic to expect a speaker, the cone of which is around 2", to produce the level of sound of a bigger speaker.  Physics can tell you why that is, but common sense should also.  Within the reasonable realm of use, this speaker is, for now, the clear winner out of what I've experienced.  The battery charge life is very nice also.  JBL understates the expected duration of the battery charge life.  I got probably more than 7 hours at a very respectable sound level.  I also like the loop at the top of the speaker.  With the loop, I can put a carbiner on the speaker, and suspend it from a belt loop.  That enables me to carry it with me at work.  Lastly, pairing with my I-phone was a breeze.  Should I have trouble with any of my other Bluetooth devices, I'll amend my review.  If you are looking for a great little Bluetooth speaker, with a long charge life, this is a wise choice.  I can comfortably recommend it to anyone looking for a portable, Bluetooth speaker for their phone, or any other Bluetooth enabled audio device.  Don't waste your time, nor money on the competition; this is the one to get.***UPDATE***After owning my JBL Bluetooth speaker for more than a month, I'd be prepared to give it an even higher rating, were one available.  I'm still amazed, and was even fooled into believing someone was in an adjoining room, where I'd left it a few minutes before.  I'd forgotten that I'd left the speaker on, and thought someone was having a conversation on his phone.  That is the quality of sound that the JBL produces.  I also have to say that the charge capacity is even better than I initially reported.  With the volume turned all the way up, the speaker continued through the entire work day with charge left over  If someone knows of a Bluetooth speaker with greater quality sound, given it's size and cost, I'd very seriously ask that they send me a comment to that effect.  Finally,in my belief,  the JBL Micro Wireless Bluetooth speaker is, if not the best of it's kind, I have yet to find a better one.  You can buy this one, and know that it would be hard to do better.***Second Update*** After more than 2 months my enthusiasm for this speaker remains as high as ever.  I never cease to be amazed at it's charge life.  Used at full volume for nearly 8 continuous hours, the speaker's battery still has charge left.  I also have to agree with the others who praise the sound of the JBL Micro.  While the bass isn't going to blow you out of your seat, for a very small speaker I still want to know if someone finds one that is better, especially at a non-astronomical price point.  I'm sure there is one out there that sounds better, but is it as small, and is it's price as reasonable?  I'll believe it only if I see it.  Yes, IT IS THAT GOOD!***Third Update****  My enthusiasm, for this speaker, just continues to grow.  Last night, at work, my mp3's battery died on me causing me to have to plug it in to a charger.  I wanted to continue to listen, and thought I'd give the speaker an opportunity to show how far I could go without losing the pairing between it and the mp3 player.  At one point I was probably at least 75 feet away from the player, and the the speaker was locked on solid.  Mind you this was line of sight, but at the same time, the building I was in was a crazy source of Radio Frequency noise.  The range of a signal is a product of signal strength, distance, and other RF noise.  AS the distance increases the signal strength drops, and eventually it drops beneath the background noise.  The signal will keep on traveling infinitely, but will be of such a low strength that it will be completely overwhelmed by noise.  I digress.  The JBL Micro seems to have a robust bluetooth receiver in it, and is well capable of receiving a very respectable distance from the source.  This is just another reason to put it on the top of your list of possible choices for a bluetooth speaker.****Fourth Update****** It has now been more than a year since I bought my JBL, and it still keeps pleasing me.  Since buying it, I have purchased 2 other bluetooth speakers, neither of which will fulfill the role the JBL Micro does.  I'd say that the 2 biggest positives with the JBL Micro are the battery charge, and the overall sound.  Again, it doesn't have the most powerful base, but the overall sound spectrum is well balanced, and voices come out sounding very natural.  The only downside I can see with the JBL Micro is one common to all Bluetooth speakers I have so far seen, and that is that there is no provision for changing out the battery once it will no longer accept a charge.  That won't stop me from changing it, though, it will just make it harder.  Still, in the final analysis, even over the Bose Soundlink II Mini, I'll take the JBL Micro for most purposes.  Definitely, it is vastly more portable than the Bose, and far less likely to bother others around me than the Bose speaker.  I still recommend the JBL Micro to anyone wanting a great quality, affordable Bluetooth speaker.  Definitely it has been worth the money.
summary: The Best Bluetooth Speaker I've Yet Found

reviewText: This speaker is a cool little speaker. Easy to connect bluetooth. Has an aux cable also. I just wish it was a little louder.

I just received my order three days ago. I was so excited and tested it out right away. The range of the volume was and the quality of the bass was great well. Today, I decided to play some music with it and then, I started to hear broken sounds from the speaker. What happened? All this time it has been in the dust bag on my desk and all the sudden, it decided to add some "extra sounds" to the music I am playing.  I am so disappointed at the quality of the speaker. I'll definitely contact them and see if I can return it, although I don't have the original package anymore.

Why give a Bluetooth speaker 5 stars if it doesn't sound awesome? Basically it has redeeming qualities that helped me overlook some of it's shortcomings. Initially I felt that it was slightly overpriced, but after having it for a couple weeks I feel that the overall quality you get made it worth the price.Design:It's classy with its modern retro black and silver color scheme. It's lightweight, and shaped like a hockey puck.  So not only is it small but it's travel friendly, since it's flat and round it can easily be carried in a backpack, jacket or even a pocket without being too blocky or being that awkward bulge.  It also has a built in loop to hang it or clip onto a ring.  It's got an aux input/ output or you can use the built in a 3.5mm wire that tucks away.  One thing I would rather have is a volume rocker instead of a dial, because of less chances of changing volume or breaking on contact.Performance:Quite good it pairs quickly, has good range, charges fast, and lasts longer than 5 hoursSound:It's definitely loud for it's size, has good mids, clear highs, and OK bass.  The mono speaker has a potential disadvantage to stereo devices. If your using it with a mobile device one thing to try, is to install an equalizer app to add a bit more bass or punch. I noticed that it sounded better connected to my phone than my tablet, but with the app it gave the tablet audio a slightly fuller sound.So if you're looking for the best sounding Bluetooth speaker in this price range, you might want to consider looking at alternatives.  However, if your looking for a Bluetooth speaker that is portable, small, lightweight, good sound, and has a unique design that stands apart from the typical bricks and cubes then the JBL Micro wireless is a great choice to consider.

reviewText: This is flat enough to put in your front pants pocket if they aren't painted on your body.  That fact alone means I use this speaker more than anything other audio equipment I have.  There is just enough base to balance out the sound and give it enough timbre to make it sound natural (not tinny).  I use it for music and talk radio with no gripes.  It can be heard from quite a long distance.  As to Bluetooth ability, I've been on the 2nd floor of my house with it on the 1st floor (multiple walls of separation) and opposite side of the house and the connection is uninterrupted.  The charge lasts in the 7-10 hour range (depending on volume) and it recharges in about an hour.  The analog volume dial is a nice return to what had always worked best - - you can kill the sound (or lower it) instantly and change it in the slightest of increments. The tether hook at the top is sort of interesting, I've worn it around my neck with a lanyard like a reincarnation of Public Enemy a couple times, but the bouncing against my stomach/chest got annoying.  Any interesting note I haven't heard anyone point out is that since this is so small and has an audio out jack, you can use it as a Bluetooth beacon for your stereo or other equipment that has a micro-jack input, making it "Bluetooth capable" as well.  While you could do this with other speakers, the small size of this one makes it such that it can be completely hidden or otherwise neatly tucked away.  Enjoy!
summary: My most used audio device . . . period
