reviewText: When bought this speaker, I was looking for a small, portable bluetooth speaker that had decent sound quality and battery life. The JBL Micro met every expectation, and then some. The size is perfect; it can fit in a jacket pocket or backpack side pouch without looking too awkward. The bluetooth connectivity is quick and simple. The battery lasts for hours of playback and charges via a microUSB. Perfect since most folks have dozens of these cords already. Most importantly, the sound quality is outstanding! Compared to the Philips "grenade" speaker (which I also own), the highs and lows are just slightly more crisp, and it packs a little bit more punch.But the JBL included features that I did  not expect. It can be hooked up to a standard audio jack using the hardwired aux input cord. And that same cord can be used as an audio-out as well. So you use bluetooth to connect your phone to the JBL, and you can plug the JBL into any audio device (car, stereo, home theater, etc) to turn it into a bluetooth bridge/receiver. Completely unexpected!Overall the quality and functionality of this unit is well with the price. A+ would buy again.
Really the perfect blue tooth speaker, I use it with my Samsung Note 3, and my I Pad.  Compact enough to fit in my bag, and great sound, well thought out, by who ever designed it.

This thing is awesome! I use it daily as my car stereo, and at work. I've always been into good sounding stereos without having to shell out the big bucks. This definitely fits the bill. I've daisy chained with my buddies Bose, and another lesser quality speaker. All worked well with independent amps, no sound was lost due to running in series. All speakers had their own range and worked together with great sound. Buy this unit, you won't be disappointed.

Just got this yesterday.  I can't believe how good it sounds and how small and light it is.  It's only about 3.5 inches wide, and 1.5 inches tall.  It's TINY.  No problems hooking it up to my Nexus 4 or Asus 300TF.  I know I am going to use this everywhere.  In the garage, on the patio, on vacation, in the bathroom, any place I want to listen to music and there aren't standard speakers around.  Doesn't come with a USB charger, so make sure you have the one for your phone or other devices with you to charge it.it's crazy good!
Plenty loud and clear for utility use on my net book.  Not meant to be a boom box or quality music box.  Perfect for news reel audio and You Tube audio which is what I bought it for.

This is a fantastic little speaker. It gets loud and stays clear - no problem filling a small to mid sized room with tunes. It excels in the mid and high ranges and the bass is very good, albeit a little conservative. I also have an Altec Lansing iM227 Orbit MP3 Speaker (wired) which I thought was one of the best I'd heard until I experienced the JBL Micro. The Altec will break-up at higher volume settings and the JBL Micro simply doesn't. The size is perfect for travel and from what I've read - not enough usage of my own to confirm - the battery life is outstanding. For what it's worth iLounge gives the Micro a great review and I've found their reviews to be pretty good for the most part.
Perfect for around the house, in the garage, while bike riding, camping, etc.. Definitely recommend this product! Great value for the money.

Excellent bluetooth speaker. I honestly was shocked with the quality and speaker max volume when I first heard it.  Given the pricing ($36 on black Friday sale on Amazon) it was a no brainer.  Though I have to admit I wasn't expecting much.  It comes with a carrying case and charging cable.  I will admit one minor quibble is the charging cable is quite short but anyone with a longer usb charging cable can take care of this (hence no stars deducted).  Overall the sound is a great the max volume is great and the shape/compactness is quite nice.  The red color is nice.  It is more of a cherry red color.
summary: Excellent sound from portable bluetooth speaker.

reviewText: The speaker sounds fine, but the manual doesn't even tell you how to turn the thing off.  And the JBL technical support claims to have "no one available at this time" no matter when you call.  To turn the speaker off, simply tap the Power Button twice.  They could have listed that in the manual, but they didn't.  Horrible communication and even worse customer service (non-existent) - sadly ironic for a speaker manufacturer.
summary: Worst manual ever!  Push Power Button twice to turn off.

reviewText: I'm amazed at the sound quality with such a small speaker! I wouldn't suggest it for a large space or noisy environment, but works great in quiet room.

this is the first tiny speaker that i actually had to turn the volume down a little cause it was not comfortable to listen to music that loud... but then again you get what you pay for with a lesser priced tiny speaker. this one can really fill up a tile laden room...
Loud and clear for a small speaker...i wish battery would last long then 5hrs but its ok i can always plug it...fast shipping....You will love it!!!
probably The best Bluetooth speakers I've heard sounds real good able to put it anywhere and a great buy even has a jack just in case u don't have a bluetooth  device..
This was a great speaker for my home workout thank you so much the sound it great an can get loud
summary: This is a very good speaker

reviewText: I love this speaker! I am a traveling training consultant, and this product is great due to its size and sound quality. Range on the Bluetooth is pretty good too.

I ordered this because I needed something small to fit in my purse and that would deliver quality sound. JBL delivered!! It was very easy to set up and I am just thrilled I purchased it! Exactly what I needed.
summary: Big sound from a tiny device!

reviewText: As a music educator, I needed something small to play tuning notes from an iPhone app. This works great––small and light enough to fit in my blazer pocket, and loud enough. For the size and money, do not expect to hear good bass if you play music.

after reading all the 5 star reviews from all over the internet...i went ahead and bought this for myself...and wow!...yes it's an incredible little speaker...so glad i bought it ...also it lasts much longer than the quoted 5hrs of play charge....i give this amazing little speaker 10 stars...for the price, sound and portability...totally worth it!

In comparison to iHome iHM60GY (which is not bluetooth), the sound is much crisper with the sound traveling a little further. For instance, when cooking in the kitchen with the dishwasher going the, iHome can not be distinctly heard above the dishwasher noise, while the JBL Micro Wireless rises above the noise admirably. You also don't have to be sitting or standing close to it to hear it well like I had to with the iHome model. The JBL Micro Wireless can be heard a couple rooms away as well. Decent bass for watching movies or listening to music (Important to me because I am hearing impaired).But--bought Aug 16, 2013 and now today Dec 18, 2013 just received an RMA for returning the JBL. Will not pair with any of my blue-tooth devices. Have fingers crossed that the replacement will last longer.FYI if you need to return/replace your JBL Micro Wireless, there is a return/replacement form on the JBL site that can be filled out and processed online. If you haven't yet registered your speaker, you'll need to do this first before requesting an RMA.I had to call to make sure the return request had been processed a week later, it had not and the rep processed it for me and emailed me an RMA#. Advise you do the same and call if you don't hear back within a week.
Sounds better than expected for such a compact size.  Nice to throw in a backpack.  Build quality is good and it is easy to pair up with a bluetooth device.

I have been looking for a Bluetooth speaker to use for a while now - when I finally decided to pull the trigger it was based on other reviews. I dint look at the specifications of the speaker before it arrived but really expected something comparable to a 6.5" speaker. To my surprise when it arrived the thing looked to be about a 2" speaker. I was immediately worried that I was going to have something barely better than the speaker on my phone. After a short charge (about an hour) I paired up (very easy) and launched Spotify. At first I didn't hear anything because the speaker was turned all the way down, once I figured that out I eased the volume up on my phone and was quite amazed by the volume of the sound that this little speaker was putting out, and also how clear it was. Sure the bass is not going to be felt in your chest but it does pump out an incredible amount of bass for something so small. I love it!I am using an HTC Amaze Android powered cell phone mostly. I also pair up my Nexus 7. Both devices pair within seconds once the speaker is turned on and sound great (much better than the built in speakers, the JBL has depth).
Great sound for the price, its compact but light, small but loud.  This is a must have trust me.Awesome speaker

Setup was a breeze.  The first time I powered on the device it automatically went into pairing mode, just found it on the iPhone hit it and it connected and started playing music through it immediately without any further action required on my part.  There is only one button that is pressed to power it on and off or held to put the speaker back into pairing mode to pair it to a different device.  There is also a single multipurpose light that tells you when the device is in pairing mode, powered on, charging, or needs charged. There is also a built in cord that will allow you to plug the speaker into anything with a headphone jack to use it with devices that don't support music playback via Bluetooth.I have mostly been keeping it charged so can't speak at all about battery life yet but it has lasted the couple hours here or there when I used it off a charger.Alright after a few days of tinkering around with this and testing out all of it's capabilities I feel like I have a solid enough feel for this little speaker to give some insight.  The main thing you have to consider is your purchasing a lightweight highly portable speaker and this isn't going to offer the best sound quality in the world.  I'm not an audiophile but I do spend a fair share of time listening to music in various setups.  The sound on this thing is average in general but incredible for a speaker this size.First and foremost is the lows.  To me lows are a big big part of music and something that the average listener may even miss out on until the hear a system with incredible bass.  The lows on this device are in general fairly crisp and clear but underwhelming to say the least.  I have noticed a few songs where low beats I'm used to hearing in my car system just aren't replicated.  This is to be expected on a speaker this size so it's not a complaint just something to keep in mind.  My main complaint and the only real reason I deducted a star is I noticed that on some rock songs with deep string bass the speaker rattles and distorts at high volume.  It's not every song but it's just enough of an annoyance to me to deduct a star.The mids and highs will go together because I have essentially the same thing to say about them.  They are both very very clear and sound just as good as they do on some of my more expensive audio solutions.  Voices are very clear and on point and everything in the mid and high range on this speaker comes out sounding amazing.The volume is adequate considering this is a small speaker that I am mostly using to clip onto a belt loop when doing work out in the yard or around the house to be able to enjoy my music with a good quality sound without having to wear cumbersome heavy headphones.One surprising feature that I thoroughly enjoyed is the aux out option.  This has allowed me to plug this speaker into my sound system at home with a cable like this http://www.amazon.com/Mediabridge-3-5mm-Male-2-Male-Adapter/dp/B004YEBK66/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid;=1390194162&sr;=8-2&keywords;=rca+to+aux and play all my bluetooth music through my sound system.  All you have to do is turn the volume wheel on the speaker all the way down and plug it in and it will play strictly through the sound system.  I love this option and am greatly surprised this as able to pull it off.  I even have a USB port on my sound system to plug this into and keep it charged while it plays.All in all the best speaker you will be able to find in this price and size range.
summary: Good sound for what it is

reviewText: Very nice. It sounds great. You will be impressed and at peace with it's high price once you hear it.The manual has limited info. I had to experiment and dig around the internet to find answers that were not in the manual.-Charge voltage is 5v 500mah-You can charge the speaker while in use-Automatic shut down after 30 mins of inactivity.-Will not work if you plug it into a regular radio, like a portable radio or Walkman. There is strong RF that comes through the wire and will completely drown out any signal. All you get is static.Performance is excellent.

I had a difficult time connecting this to my bluetooth on my ipad.  The second time I went to do it, it would not connect.Also, the battery life on these is less than 5 hrs.  I am returning these and won't be buying a JBL product again.
summary: Not Simple to Use or Reliable

reviewText: I love this speaker so much.  I recommended it to co-workers and they have since purchased from this seller.  Will be buying another one.

I'm very picky with sound quality and this speaker really does it for me. The size is perfect for carrying it around but I don't know how much the battery last because I haven't test it that long. You won't be dissapointed!

Good sound, but having continuing problem using it with an iPhone.  I have no problems pairing this speaker with my MacBook Air, but after working as advertised for the first week with a relatively new iPhone 5, it now refuses to pair up with it or an iPod Touch.  The saving grace is the short plug-in connection, so I have been able to use it, but not as intended.  I would not have purchased it had I known connectivity would be such a problem.

I bought a Jawbone Jambox several months ago but was never completely happy with it. For the price, it seemed the sound was a touch muddy, the volume a bit low, and the physical weight a little heavy.So I began looking for a lighter, equal-or-better sounding alternative. After some online research and a few visits to local electronics stores, I found the JBL Micro Wireless. At $60 it was affordable, it was lightweight, and the volume and clarity exceeded what I was getting with my Jambox.Pros:* Very light and compact. Easy to toss in a backpack or jacket pocket* Great sound clarity. JBL's writeup emphasizes the bass response (because the world has been trained to equate thumpy bass with sound quality), but while the bass is solid for such a small box, the real win is that this tiny speaker produces a clean, precise sound even at relatively high volumes. Audiophile? No. Great for the money and convenience? Yes!* Volume dial lets you lock in a sound level even when turning the speaker on and off* Simple and solid. Just the two controls you need: power and volumeCons:* Not stereo. But that's a tradeoff I can live with for the convenience* Clip loop is a bit awkward. I thought I might hang it off a picture hook on my office wall, but the size and position of the loop requires a fairly lengthy (3/4 inch or so) hook length.
summary: Great sound from a compact, simple package. Goodbye Jambox.

reviewText: This speaker sounds great and gets loud for it's size. I use it for listening to TV on my phone, and have used it at work when playing training videos in the office which allowed several people sitting as far away as ~20' to hear it. The bluetooth works great, and I love the 3.5mm plug which gives you the option to save battery as well as the ability to use it with non-BT enabled devices. And the cord tucks away easily and cleanly. I also like that the volume adjustment is a dial, not buttons. For a while I was thinking the one thing I'd change about it is the addition of a kickstand, but then I realized it actually stands up on its own, just like in the picture.

Sound is very good considering its small size. Highly portable design is one of the best feature. Bluetooth range is about 25-30 ft. It starts to sputter if the range is beyond 30 ft. Overall, i like it.

I got this for a friend.  She is in love with it.  The low end is pretty nice for such a small unit.  And overall it sounds better than units at twice the price.  It arrived quickly and packaged very well. Great for your nightstand or desk at work.  We love it.
I have has several Bluetooth speakers for the size and cost this sound good. Not as good as the JBL charge and my Jawbone big jambox. But fo. $60 this small size and sound are a good deal
Got a speaker from china is not jbl and my phone is louder then this thing.  Maybe it was my fault new to Amazon

I attached this to my disc golf bag and we have pumping tunes for the whole group!Best bluetooth connectivity I've encountered, battery life rocks, and the speaker performs very well acoustically.What jkept me from giving it 5 stars is the volume knob goes up and down as it bounces off my golf bag, so I had to superglue it at 100% and control volume from my phone.  No big deal.
Great product bang for  your buck. Wish is it was a little louder, but really I have had no issues here.

I purchased this product to enhance the audio output of my laptop and recently purchased smart phone.  After reading some of the mostly positive reviews, I decided to get it.  It exceeded my every expectation.  Very pleased!  Only disparaging comment I would make is, not being an electronics guru, I didn't quite understand the procedures for charging it, and for me, I was confused at first, as to how to do that, but I don't blame the product for that, I blame my inexperience.  It didn't take long to figure it out, and it performs great.  Hard to believe such a small compact speaker can put out such a large quality sound.
summary: Great sound, great price, great product.

reviewText: I love this speaker! First bluetooth speaker I have bought and NOT being connected is the best. It is pretty amazing how far this little guy works with a clear line of sight. If you get out of range, when you come closer it reconnects and you are gettin down again. You really need to shop around because the prices are all over the map!
This little speaker gets down and is worth every penny. It's sounds better than some of the cars I hear around town.

This speaker does exactly what you think, gives you decent volume, and once cranked it has a good bass response. Can't complain, the bluetooth distance reaches pretty far, great product by JBL, definitely recommend this.

This tiny speaker packs a serious volume punch. I adore it! It is so small and holds a charge for a long time. The sound quality is amazing and it has a decent amount of bass considering how small it is.

I own the HMDX Audio  JAM Bluetooth Wireless Speaker and I just bought the JBL Micro Wireless speaker. I compared them by using 2 iphone 5 connected to the same song on youtube and played them at the same time. After fading the volume up and down on each speaker it is clear that even though the HMDX Jam is a little louder the JBL definitely a clearer and cleaner sound. I use this outside while working construction. All my coworkers are amazed at the big sound coming from this little speaker. It says it will last 5 hours but I have been using it most of the day on my 10 hour shift and I have not had it die on me yet. Maybe because we don't always play it at full volume. I love it!!!
summary: HMDX Audio JAM vs JBL Micro wireless

reviewText: Had it up and running a minute after I unpacked it. Just hit the little bluetooth button, pair it with your phone, and you're listening to music. I cranked this puppy all the way up, and it didn't distort at all. It fills the room with sound that's crisp and clear. It didn't cut out or anything with the bluetooth, and I listened for a while. Plays excellently with Pandora as well. Got a free bass boost for my Android phone, and it even made the bass better.Walked all over my apartment, and it didn't lose the signal at all.The other thing that's great is that it's so tiny and lightweight. I can take it anywhere.I chose this, because JBL has such a good reputation, and they're known for making speakers.Very happy with my purchase.
Hooked it up to my IPad, set up the Bluetooth wireless setting and walked around my house with great sound and no interference. I would buy it again.

Thanks JBL ! Really surprised to see the performance & build quality of this small portable speaker. its really the best quality Bluetooth speaker in the market by considering size and price  ... the sound quality is very sharp and it has great base (definitely much better base then its size), However i tried it in noise outside area.. its working great !
The one I got seems like already be opened. I deeply doubt if it is new! But this one works.
summary: The one I got seems like already be opened.

reviewText: This is a great little speaker!  I use this far more then I ever thought I would.  Whether listening to podcasts while getting ready for work or music around the house the sound is fantastic.  Easy to connect with my iphone/ipad I can't imagine not having it.  The sound quality is very good for whatever type of music you listen to. I usually have to charge it once every other week.  I would highly recommend.

Incredible great sound for such a little speaker. The only downside (but it's not the speaker's fault) is that every time I receive a notification as I'm listening to some music, the notification interrupts the music. I'm sure there's a workaround but I'm too lazy to look for it. I love the speaker anyway.
The speaker was easy to pair with my cellDespite very small size (which is what I want) the sound is very good, clear and accurateVery good product
summary: Excellent sound - very compact and light

reviewText: This is a really great little speaker.  I was surprised at how loud it was for the size.  I only bought one, but now that I have heard it, and I know you can link them, I will be purchasing more!  It will be great on the beach, or on the patio, or just to boost up the sound on my laptop!  Awesome buy!  You won't regret it.
summary: Really great sound for the price

reviewText: Just got my JBL yesterday, and I have to said the bass are powerful, yet the mids is clear. Also, gonna love never have to deal with wire again thanks for bluetooth!!
summary: small sized but sure packs a punch in sound!

reviewText: First, the sound is better than expected.  Granted I had relatively low expectations considering the size and the reported build quality.  Well, I'm impressed on all fronts.For its size, price, and features, I can definitively say that the fidelity is very good and the speaker itself of decent build.  It's fairly dense and has some heft to it; this to maximize the low end response in a very small frame.  The default balance between high and low is pretty good as well.  The bluetooth range from my iPhone5 is about 30-35ft without obstruction.  I greatly appreciate the fact that it can operate while charging.  Sorry, I haven't thoroughly tested battery life yet.I'm certainly not implying it can go head-to-head with even low priced amplified speaker sets.  IMO, it does however match or exceed comparably priced portable speakers, pound for pound.  So far I'm happy with the purchase.

This bluetooth speaker can hold its own.  We recently went to a packed beach on Memorial Weekend and we can clearly hear the music from this speaker even though there were others playing their music.  One of my friend who brought his speaker had to shut his off since this JBL speaker was a lot louder than his.I read a lot of reviews for bluetooth speakers of this size and I purchased this speaker for its clarity and ability to be played at a loud volume.  This JBL speaker has certainly met those qualities.  The sound is very clear and it can be played to the max volume without any distortion.  The other item to note about this speaker is the old school volume knob/adjuster, some people might find this not so appealing, but I actually like this better than a press button type of adjuster.  The volume level stays on the setting you last set it rather than re-adjusting to 50% of the volume like some devices that have the press button adjuster or some kind of digital adjuster.The only con about this speaker is the price.  To me it's a little bit on the expensive side for its size but I guess you get what you pay for.
Battery lasts a long time. Wireless connections is great. The sound is fantastic, really loud. Very clear as well as loud. Purchased a few others as gifts for Christmas.
